Reviews.Title: “Perfect boutique hotel in shopping paradise”
Reviews.Author: Worldfoodies
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with a girlfriend for a shopping expedition of Barcelona. The hotel is located on a beautiful walking street in the area of Eixample. This is where all the upmarket shopping and dining is in Barcelona. The hotel is about a 15 minute walk to the Ramblas area but away from all the noise and tourists to enjoy a peaceful nights sleep. The rooms are quite small but furnished beautifully and we had a small balcony which we had coffee on each morning. The concierge desk was extremely helpful and both the bar, restaurant and breakfast were fantastic. The bar had an exclsuive outdoor area on the walking street where you can have drinks and food and watch the world walk by. There is no pool here but you head over to their sister hotel "Hotel Majestic" and use their incredible roop top pool and bar. Even if you don't go for a swim, head over to take in the sunset and 360 degree views of Barcelona with a cocktail in hand. The spa at The Majestic is also incredible and I had the best manicure and pedicure here. A top notch place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location for the Apartments”
Reviews.Author: BlindTom
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a two bedroom apartment with terrace, so I can't comment on the hotel rooms. The apartment was great, around the corner from the hotel down a slightly more quiet alley full of restaurants. The apartment was quite spacious, and is perfect for a family (particularly one that has been travelling together for a while). The room was modern, and all of the appliances worked properly. The washing machine was a bit of a challenge, but that is always the case in Europe. Housekeeping was a little spotty in places, but that is just quibbling. If you are looking for somewhere to stay in the Eixample, this is perfect. Close to the shopping and attractions, but also close to the neighboring Gracia -- probably the most underrated part of the City.

Reviews.Title: “Truly an experience with great modern touches”
Reviews.Author: slurer
Reviews.Content: First time in BCN in Nov 11 and weather was great. Murmuri has great feel to its contemporary, and fusion-like decor, completed with modern touches to the finer details of room lighting to cater for different moods. You could see the level of details placed by the designer - sound systems, mood lighting and overall decor. Concierge/front office was helpful. Internet costs in Spain is generally expensive but was not a must during my vacation. Definitely worth returning as a couple stay! Looking forward to my next trip there!

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but could do better for the price”
Reviews.Author: proffesser
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights over a long wkend. Location is good, close to some good restaurants and attractions but far enough from la Ramblas to be quiet and relaxing. Hotel looks nice and staff were polite and reasonably helpful, but did not extend themselves beyond answering direct questions (if you didn't know the exact question to ask, don't expect a helpful answer). One complaint was the fact that our room wasn't made up one day (by 5pm) and after calling reception the maid appeared at the door apparently annoyed that we should ask! Also, do not expect tea/coffee facilities in the room and a late checkout will cost you a fair bit. On the plus side, there is a small roof terrace, the rain shower in our room was great and the hotel seemed very quiet (didn't hear neighbours). I would go back if the price was right.

Reviews.Title: “Hmmm.... back-up hotel only”
Reviews.Author: Dainis K
Reviews.Content: I been traveling to Barcelona frequently. I like the city, the spirit, food, wine and people. Parties and clubs as well. There are stylish hotels and Murmuri I expected to be one of them ( by web page). And it is true, or more precisely: it was true. Right now my filing was: this hotel was overtaken by the bank and now run in lowest possible way. Hotel has great location. However, do not expect to have exactly the same room as you can see on web page. Instead of superior room with the sun beds you may receive small room with small balcony. And room safe small and dark, indeed. Some personnel is nice and friendly, bat majority is very unprofessional. They may promise to book the restaurant, but never do it. Breakfast is OK for 3-star restaurant, but not excellent for 4-5 star place. Please, tomatoes for breakfast are not expensive in Spain! You may use gym at the neighbor hotel Majestyic. Unfortunately this is small and terrible 4 square meter place. Double bad was just two beds close to each other and not useful for sleeping for 2 persons. Well, this pricy place definitely not wort it. There are plenty other options around.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel needs restoration”
Reviews.Author: Ekaterina_Siver
Reviews.Content: Location is good, generally hotel is nice, bar is great, service is good but all the furniture is really old, hot water is working really bad.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous boutique hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: kirstyrae
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Murmuri over the Easter Bank Holiday and we were so glad we booked this hotel! Our room (211) was beautifully decorated and spacious and the bed was so comfy. Also, the air conditioning was great as we could adjust the temperature to just how we like it. Our room also had a spacious terrace where we could enjoy a drink and watch the world go by. Another plus is that, although the hotel doesn't have it's own spa, you can go to their sister hotel The Majestic - which is just around the corner- and charge everything to your room.The hotel is in a fantastic location; it takes about 15 minutes to walk to Las Ramblas and the Gotic area and is just around the corner from some of Gaudi's famous buildings. It also has loads of great places to eat all in walking distance, plus the Metro is a minute's walk from the hotel. The hotel staff were excellent and they recommended some fantastic restaurants. The hotel also has a restaurant and a bar, although I'm sad to say we didn't try either. We will definitely try both when we return to Barcelona and we will absolutely be staying at the Hotel Murmuri again!

Reviews.Title: “Stylish Hotel, Stylish Location.”
Reviews.Author: jonnychick
Reviews.Content: This Hotel is situated in a fabulous location in a lovely part of town.The Hotel is very stylish and its staff are friendly and attentive. I highly recommend this hotel, brilliant!!

Reviews.Title: “Chic hotel in excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Paul C
Reviews.Content: Great little boutique hotel smack in the middle of upscale shopping outlets, and one block away from Gaudi's stunning La Pedrera. Fashionista shoppers will hit all major brands within a 6 square block radius. Hotel's design is modern and chic. Front desk staff are friendly and helpful. Wifi is free in the lobby but not in the rooms (12 Euros / day). Rooms are nicely done (not big though) and clean. Bathroom is nice too with embroidered linens. Water temperature is a bit unstable so you might get surprise stabs of cold water during a shower. The only gripe I would have is I asked for some hot water and they delivered a jug to my room but charged me 3 Euros for it...which I thought was a bit odd since hotels rarely charge for hot water. Other than that, our stay was pleasant and enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Great, Centrally Located and Modern!”
Reviews.Author: Joen J
Reviews.Content: Were in Barcelona for the marathon and stayed a couple of days to the sites (Gaudi - Sagrada Familia). The hotel was centrally located so we could easily walk to the sites or take the metro which is excellent in Barcelona. The hotel has a modern but very comfortable feel to it and the receptionists were very helpful in making good restaurant recommendations (Cachitos is close by and a great tapas place) There is also a very nice roof deck where you can take a cup of coffee and read a good book in peace and quiet. If I was there on business the only downfall would be that the hotel doesn't have a gym and you can really go for a run in that part of the city. However, for site seeing and traveling through Barcelona it's a great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “First night with outstanding interior, but let down with room service.”
Reviews.Author: c D
Reviews.Content: This is a lovely, airy, open building with natural light able to create a lovely environment. The rooms are a generous size with comfy furniture and a variety of drinks to choose from at prices not even a millionaire would pay for a coke. The staff are more than welcoming, smart and helpful, room easy to find with good security and the variety of lighting within the room gives you the opportunity to customise your room how you want it. Bar is not great though, quite and un lively and room service it not good either when waiting for your complimentary drinks and nibbles. We will have to wait to have them tomorrow now as we had to go out, after waiting an hour. This is all just for half a day.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stau”
Reviews.Author: TaliesinH
Reviews.Content: Second time staying at Murmuri- and it was great as the first. Best location at the top of the Ramblas and close to the Diagonal, the restaurant food is about the best I could find, and the designer style throughout of this small street-front hotel feels good. Rooms are not big but bathrooms nicely designed. The only negative is the cumbersome and expensive wifi system that cost $10 per day and it is annoying to have to keep logging in. But overall Mirmuri is highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel is better than apartment”
Reviews.Author: RWWColorado
Reviews.Content: I booked a stay last week in a one bedroom apartment at Murmuri. While I can see the advantage if you need a kitchen, I didn't like the location very much. It is down the street and around a corner and not attached to the hotel itself. There was no bathtub. After 2 nights there, I asked to be switched to the hotel and found it much nicer. The rooms were lovely and the amenities very nice. The staff is, for the most part, very helpful. I would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “First Visit to Hotel Murmuri”
Reviews.Author: Neocis
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for two nights towards the end of April 1012 whilst on business. The room was a "privilage" double room which is slighty more expensive than the normal (slightly bigger and with the possibility of a terrace). The room was perfect in every way; stylish, spotless, quiet etc. (the iPod dock is a nice touch) and staff could not have been more helpful. I managed to get a terrace but since it was raining a good part of the time I didn't get the chance to use it. It was fine but you would have to be quite tall to see properly over the walls - the view was not really good but that was really the "luck of the draw". Breakfast was separate and expensive for what it was (11 euros) - buffet style but not a huge choice on offer but this seems to be the way for other hotels in Barcelona I have stayed in. Wi-Fi Internet access is free in the lounge and free for one hour in the second floor lobby (although since I used the service in the room so I can't vouch for this). Wi-Fi in the room is only worth it for 24 hrs (11 euros) and I suggest to take a network cable and plug it in , rather than depend on the wireless. Location is excellent and Metro is 5 mins walk away although as warned everywhere hang onto your valuables.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: Berylruth
Reviews.Content: Stayed in Hotel Murmuri Barcelona for a long weekend. Great little hotel and a fantastic location for the tourist bus, shops. Hotel has a really sophisticated feel. Really nice room with a small terrace. Staff very helpful. A perfect place for a short city break.

Reviews.Title: “Loved This Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A K S
Reviews.Content: We stayed at hotel Murmuri for four nights in mid January. We booked a Privilege Double room and requested that our room have a balcony overlooking the Rambla de Catalunya. We were very pleased with the room we were given. It was spacious, nicely decorated and had a nice little balcony. The staff at the hotel were very good. We had some great tapas and cocktails in the bar happily served by Nick, who was very helpful in what to see and where to go for nice food, so many thanks to him. Overall we were pleased with all aspects of hotel MurMuri. It is sure to please those who enjoy the boutique hotel experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great ambience, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Sam M
Reviews.Content: Hotel Murmuri was great. Very nice comfortable rooms, mellow atmosphere. Francesco at the front desk gave me some great tips for where to go for dinner and a drink on a late Sunday evening. His advice led me to a nice spot on the ocean. I highly recommend Hotel Murmuri.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: love2travel1985
Reviews.Content: I traveled with my 10 year old daughter. The hotel is beautiful and clean. The staff was very friendly and helpful. They were exceptionaly kind to my daughter. All their dining recommendations were right on target. We had an awesome stay. The hotel is situated one block from Gaudi's La Pedrera, great shopping and a Metro stop. Perfect location.

Reviews.Title: “Great location & Beautiful Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jen B
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the Hotel Murmuri a hand full of times while visiting Barcelona on business. It's on a great street and has a nice staff. The rooms are a bit small, but are nice. I enjoyed my room with a patio facing the side street vs. facing the louder front of the building. The beds are comfortable and the rooms are very modern. I recommend this hotel especially with their location.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful and confortable”
Reviews.Author: gusmansur
Reviews.Content: The location is perfect just in Rambla Catalunya and with de Metro station just on the corner. The staff very frendly and rooms with a beautiful design as all the hotel. The rooms very quiet and more comfortable than I was already in Spain. But some points need to improve: 1. Wifi is one of the most expensive I've ever seen. For a hotel of this quality I expected that the internet connection was a courtesy. In the room I got the wifi only worked well in my notebook. On my iPhone and iPad simply not connected because the signal was very weak. Big disappointment! 2. Another downside for this hotel is the breakfast. With a very limited buffet for a high cost of 16 euros. The options are exactly the same every day. For those 7 days it was enough to be annoying.

Reviews.Title: “What a wonderful place”
Reviews.Author: MrsLokita
Reviews.Content: Hubby and I spent the first two nights of our trip at the Hotel Murmuri during our September 2011 vacation. What a lovely place to stay! The staff was incredibly friendly, very young and happy people :-). The hotel is pretty small with great atmosphere. The room was also small but VERY nice and clean. The locations is great...it is located in a very safe neighborhood; very close the the chic and trendy "Paseo de Gracia" and Gaudi's masterpieces La Pedrera and Casa Batlo. There are a lot of great cafes and pastry places around the area. If you want to stay away from all the noise of La Rambla this a perfect place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Very well placed hotel with helpful staff.”
Reviews.Author: realesclarmonde
Reviews.Content: We only had three days at the hotel and wished we could stay longer. Lovely balcony, enormous bed and huge bathroom. Room service was good and fast. Chocolates left on bed for the night. Cannot wait until our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Love the Murmuri!”
Reviews.Author: TerriAmosBritt
Reviews.Content: I love this hotel and the staff! I came to Barcelona for three weeks for a cutting-edge spine surgery at the nearby Chiari Institut de Barcelona and had planned to only stay at the Murmuri for three days until I could find an apartment. However, after seeing how comfortable the hotel is and centrally located, as well as how safe it felt, I knew I wanted to stay longer. Plus, the staff was amazing! As I healed from my surgery, I was able to travel a little and went to Montserrat for a couple of days to stay at the monastery hotel. The Murmuri hotel staff didn't even blink. They took my heavy luggage and stored it for me until I returned. As I continued to add days here to my stay, going back and forth, they constantly gave me great rates, instead of jacking them up to the current daily rates. I am still here right now as I write this. I am looking to take another trip away this weekend for a few days and still can't lug large suitcases around. I know without a doubt they will hold my big bags until I return for my last few days here. What a relief to know that I am taken care of and can trust that all is well!

Reviews.Title: “What a wondeful place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: SLMKC
Reviews.Content: The service was excellent, especially Francesco who was a great help to us and was most gracious. The hotel is beautiful, clean, safe feeling and in a fantastic location. We will stay there again for business or pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous hotel with lots of closet space”
Reviews.Author: Saffolein
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with colleagues for about four days, and shared a room with one of them. The room was a regular double room, I think, and absolutely gorgeous! And it had the most closet space I have ever encountered in a regular double room. I was very impressed, haha. The room was quiet during the night since it was facing the inner yard, and the beds felt very nice. The different lighting options of the room also was a nice touch. A cute corner balcony came with the room, and bathroom very cool. BUT the shower, being a bit hard to clean properly, had some mold between the tiles. Too bad, bc it brought down the look and feeling of an otherwise great bathroom. Also, the lobby bar is really nice. Needless to say, the location is great and close to "everything". All in all, I would love to stay there again, as long as I get a fresh bathroom. :)

Reviews.Title: “fantastic hotel apartment in great location”
Reviews.Author: suzannemcgeachan
Reviews.Content: we stayed here for a long weekend at the beginning of December and had the most fantastic time, it is a really well located hotel, we booked the 2 bedroom apartment (Liceu) which was a brilliant apartment, spotlessly clean, fully equipped kitchen, well furnished and loads of space with a lovely private terrace. I would highly recommend this place for a stay, the hotel staff were really helpful with maps and suggestions of places to visit and booking restaurants for us and the hotel is so well located that you are right in the middle of some fantastic restaurants and bars and a 10 minute stroll down to Las Ramblas. We didn't eat at the hotel as there were so many places around to try that had been previously recommended to us but we did have a late night cocktail in the bar one of the evenings and they were lovely .... but VERY pricey.

Reviews.Title: “Excelent option at the best part of the city”
Reviews.Author: Fernando G
Reviews.Content: We just stayed at Murmuri and it is a place to come back as many times as possible. We were 4, me, my wife and our 2 kids. We took one of their apartments (Liceu) and it was an excelent choice. Since the reservation, made by the website, we received a nice, usefull service from the kind staff. The apartment is clean, quiet, has a well equiped kitchen, a Nespresso machine and everything we needed to enjoy our stay. As I said, the staff was nice the entire time and we recommend this place with no remarks.

Reviews.Title: “great stay”
Reviews.Author: tissiou
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Murmuri in August and was thrilled. The location is really central, the hotel itself isn't that big but has everything you could expect of a big hotel. The service is top notch, the staff is really nice and helpful, the concierge recommended very good tapas bars and restaurants. The rooms although aren't that big but they're really nice, and the bed so comfy and cosy. The decoration was exquisite. In room breakfasts weren't ever the same, different sizes of fruit juices, not thhe same breads and with or without milk for the coffee, but still, all in all it was a truly great find. I really had a great time and would defenitly go there again.

Reviews.Title: “Little gem”
Reviews.Author: WeekendAdventurers
Reviews.Content: Our friends chose this hotel as part of a package for a 5-day getaway to Barcelona for the 4 of us. We loved it! The location is fabulous for great food, shopping and relaxed rambling around the city. Lots of modern touches you might expect in a boutique hotel - great mattress, preset lighting programs, built in closet with lots of shallow stacked drawers that make it easy to sort clothes, towel warmer, etc. The restaurant's asian fusion tasting menu was on par with the better restaurants we found here in TripAdvisor. We loved being able to have access to amenities like the fitness center at the hotel's "big sister," the Majestic without having to stay in a bigger hotel. Staff was very friendly and helpful, particularly with respect to offering an early check-in on arrival from a transatlantic flight.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely room and friendly service”
Reviews.Author: HighlandRacer
Reviews.Content: I travelled to Barcelona for a short business trip with an overnight stay. The hotel is well located - close to shopping and not far from the main tourist attractions. The staff were extremely helpful - checking within a few minutes of arrival that the room was to my liking. I will stay here again on my next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Love this Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Derek Z
Reviews.Content: I cannot say enough good things about this hotel. My wife and I stayed here for the second part of our honeymoon, which we took two years after getting married (have to save up money for a trip to Europe!). Coming from London on our anniversary, we arrived and were led to our room quickly. The staff knew it was our anniversary, and had provided us with some sparkling wine and strawberries. The room was large, and we had a balcony overlooking the Rambla Catalunya. A ten minute walk south on Catalunya brings you to the city square, and Las Ramblas, the big street of Barcelona. Throughout our stay, the staff at the Murmuri were very attentive and quick to respond to any questions. All in all, this hotel exceeded all of my expectations. As a bonus, staying here gives you access to the rooftop pool of the Murmuri's sister hotel, located only a few blocks away. Show them your room key, and they have towels and everything for you!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice”
Reviews.Author: MJS1983
Reviews.Content: I would highly recommend this hotel as the price, location and service was excellent. When we arrived we were told that our room was not ready and that we would be moved to their sister hotel, The Majestic. I was not concerned as I has stayed at The Majestic before and it was a superior hotel to the Murmuri. The staff escorted us the short walk to The Majestic and we were given a suite for the night and told that our room would be ready the next day. They even collected our bags and took them back to the Murmuri. When back at the Murmuri we were not disappointed. The room was well decorated and very clean. The staff at the hotel were so helpful, recommending places to eat and things to do. The location was great, on a quieter street but an easy walk to the main streets. The hotal has a lovely bar with seating on the street, again the service was excellent. We loved our stay in Barcelona and when we return would certainly stay at the Murmuri again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay and friendly services”
Reviews.Author: WSFSingapore
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful stay in the hotel from 15 Dec to 18th Dec 2011. The room is clean and spacious and the service is friendly. We had a good experience with Mr Francesco who is managing the night shift.He is helpful and friendly. We would like to stay in the same hotel in our next visit to Barcelona. Woo from Singapore

Reviews.Title: “Modern Hotel, Friendly Staff, Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: Ptk813
Reviews.Content: We would return to Hotel Murmuri over and over. The staff was superb, friendly, knowledgable, helpful. The rooms were well sized, bright, quiet, well appointed. The location was ideal. I really felt at home, which is strange, but that is how you were made to feel. The one negative was the internet connection. A real pain. You had to get a new password each hour...this should be handled. Finally, the decor was just right, comfortable and attractive.

Reviews.Title: “"Good location"”
Reviews.Author: bonnevie100
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Murmuri for 6 nights during our last trip to Barcelona and selected it based on the recommendations on Tripadvisor and the upscale-ish location. The hotel is located on a tree lined street that is very charming with shops and restaurants. After first being given a room that overlooked a basketball court, we were relocated to a much better room with a balcony overlooking the street. I was very disappointed by the staff who barely acknowledged us when we would walk in and out of the hotel. We had a hard time sleeping at night because of the music blasting up through the vents from the club downstairs. I have stayed in many higher-end boutique hotels and never dealt with such standoffish hotel staff. In the end, I would have rather paid to stay in a warmer environment with a staff of people who want to make our stay memorable!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely modern small hotel”
Reviews.Author: 42ChrisS
Reviews.Content: I stayed two nights in mid December, and would return to the hotel again. My complaints are minor -- limited hours for room service, and the restaurant serves a kind of tired nouvelle Asian fusion cuisine that one can get anywhere -- not worth it when Barcelona has such good food elsewhere. On the plus side, I checked in to my "privilege" class room, and was given 407, facing the back of the building, with a kind of glassed-in sitting area instead of an actual balcony. So I asked for a balcony room, and was immediately switched to 410, which was perfect. Great little iron balcony on the front facade of the hotel, with two chairs and a table and a wonderful view all the way down the Rambla de Catalunya to the Placa Catalunya. Room was tastefully furnished, big bathtub, everything worked, no complaints whatsoever. As for noise, the glass door to the balcony was double or triple pane glass, and there's a blackout curtain to pull across the window at night, plus the Rambla Catalunya is a quieter street than most in this area. So I barely heard a low-level of street noise, really not a problem. Would definitely stay here again, especially as a solo traveler or on business. It's clean, convenient, maybe lacking some of the charm of Barcelonas more architecturally interesting hotels like the Banys, but a worthwhile trade off.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent botique hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: ICE-MOH
Reviews.Content: I stayed with my family at this hotel for a week during our last visit to Barcelona. The hotel was not our first choice, as we are regular guests at the majestic hotel in Paseo de Gracia. but hotel Murmuri did not disappoint. the location is great and in walking distance to many cafes, restaurants and stores. Rooms were large and clean, With a nice bathroom. The front office staff were very helpful and attentive. We would definitely chose hotel Murmuri again.

Reviews.Title: “Chic boutique hotel in a trendy area”
Reviews.Author: FSR99
Reviews.Content: In Eixample (not old Barcelona) but in a beautiful neighborhood on the Rambla de Catalunya - a beautiful boulevard lined with cafes. Shopping is mostly Rodeo Drive level. Near a cople of amazing Gaudi buildings and a short metro hop from the Gaudi Sagrada Familia. Entrance to metro is 1 half block away so the city is literally at your doorstep. "Privilege double" room was on the small side but beautifully fitted out. Included breakfast was more than adequate. My only complaint was the outrageous Internet rates as noted in other reviews. Hard to understand when even McDonalds offers free access. I do not choose to carry my laptop on outings so I was stuck!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel in perfect location - as long as you don't need convenient internet service.”
Reviews.Author: TravelProGa
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in November 2011 for 5 nights. Being a part of a membership group I was entitled to "free" interent service. Well, this is partially true - as it was free for one device. However, traveling with a smart phone and an iPad - you could only be logged onto one device at a time - and logging in and out was an absolute complicated pain. The staff almost seemed embarrassed that this was the case and although they said the right things - one knew that they were well aware of how frustrating it is to guests. Rest assured this was not their first complaint. As a traveler who was expecting to be able to research the area quickly, send texts and emails to family and friends, this was made exceedingly difficult. Thank goodness Mauri, a lovely bakery around the corner, had free, reliable and uncomplicated internet service. I finally gave up on trying to use the hotel's service - and just visited there and enjoyed pastries and cafe. Needless to say, all I recieved from Murmuri was "we're sorry." As the above states - stay here if you like clean uncluttered style in an ideal location - but with no need for internet service. Can't imagine how many travelers these day that will work for - but if so - you'll love it.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely!”
Reviews.Author: misstraveler1
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hotel Murmuri for just two nights on a short city break, the staff was very helpful and polite, the rooms clean (althought a bit small) and the location fantastic!! A plus would be to add more items to their breakfast buffet! I would definately recomend and stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel, Great Location & Reasonably Priced”
Reviews.Author: Nitra315
Reviews.Content: I could not have been more pleased with my decision to stay at Hotel Murmuri for a Thanksgiving week mini-vacation with a friend. The hotel is located on Rambla de Catalunya with restaurants and shops lining the street. It was steps away from the Diagonal metro, parallel to Paseig de Gracia - a major high-end (window) shopping destination that's also home to Gaudi's La Pedera/Casa Mila (among others), and a 10-15 min walk from La Rambla. It was literally walking distance to everything, so the location could not be beat! This hotel is the equivalent of a boutique hotel in the U.S. - small, but efficient, quiet, clean and modern with beds, bedrooms and bathrooms sized like US hotel equivalents. I booked a room on the top floor with a private terrace and 2 double beds for under $200USD/night. If we needed new towels or an iron they were just a phone call away. My only pet peeve was that they did not have wash cloths (only handtowels and regular towels), so I would suggest that you bring your own to plan to buy them in town. The front desk staff spoke English fluently and ensured that we were able to check-in immediately upon arrival at 10am. I unfortunately neglected to get the name of one of the women at the front desk who made fantastic lunch and dinner recommendations (Tenorio and Tragaluz respectively) - she was our culinary savior after one too many meals at sub-par tapas restaurants near La Rambla. When we checked out of the hotel at 5am, they promptly called us a taxi that arrived within minutes. Needless to say, I had a great time, and if my travels take me back to Barcelona, there's no question I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for price”
Reviews.Author: dgaronce
Reviews.Content: We loved the location, and the rooms were great. Standard boutique hotel- not too cheapy feeling. Do not expect a concierge with knowledge of great local spots (his #1 suggestion for a night cocktail was the hard rock cafe)- but if you have your own plan, which we did, this is a great base in a cool neighbourhood.

Reviews.Title: “Poor Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: Rob V
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the hotel at approximately 10am. We were told we had to wait for our room and for our invonvenience we would be upgraded. We decided to go do some sightseeing. We retuned at approximately 1pm and were told our room wasn't ready and would be ready in a half hour. We had some drinks in the hotel while we waited. We went back to the front desk at about 2pm and still they said our room wasn't ready. The front desk manager then made a phone call upstairs and said our room wasn't ready however, they said we were being downgraded back to a standard room because a big group which had booked a bunch of standard rooms had just conveniently cancelled and now our standard room was available. We finally get to our room and the safe is not functioning. We get that rectified and and there way of compensating us for our inconvenience was providing us with free wifi for our stay (about half a day) mind you it barely worked and we couldn`t get a signal and so really they gave us nothing. Finally, we had to leave the following day and had a arranged a taxi for 11am. Of course, the front desk messed it up and the cab arrived 15 min early so we were rushing and of course he had started the meter. Keep in mind this wasour final stop on our honeymoon and we were heading home. Long story short, the taxi driver drops us off at the wrong terminal and we have to take another taxi to the next terminal. Total cost: 70 Euros or approximately $100 CAD. Our worst stay by far on our honeymoon. Avoid this hotel at all costs. Poorly managed and they don`t know how to treat their out of town guests.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded Expectations!”
Reviews.Author: Ann R
Reviews.Content: We took a long weekend to Barcelona and found this hotel to be fantastic. It quite honestly exceeded our expectations in so many ways. We love boutique hotels and this did not disappoint. The decor is beautiful - upscale contemporary with a great, hip, yet comfortable, feel. We stayed in a Privilege category room with a balcony - the room was a typical European size, not enormous but certainly not too small. We loved the "mood" lighting with lighting panels throughout the room - with one touch - the lights dim to a cozy atmosphere - or get brighter (4 options). The bathroom was fairly large and simply beautiful. We used the fitness facilities at their sister hotel - it was a 5 minute walk down the street. The only drawback, I will say, is their internet access is a bit spotty. But... the staff is what made our stay so memorable. Roberto bent over backwards to make sure we were comfortable every time we walked by the front desk. Absolutely work with Francesco, the concierge, who literally created our vacation experience for us. He made countless phone calls, got us into last minute tours, switched venues around to accommodate our changing schedule and was just flat our amazing! We highly recommend this hotel and we will be back!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: barnyardMoraira
Reviews.Content: We booked through the website Mr and Mrs Smith on arrival the hotel had upgraded our room to one with a terrace, the room was small but very comfortable and nice, a little on the dark side, however was a little suprised that this room was a step up from the one I had originally booked so am not sure what that would have been like. The staff were pleasant and polite. The breakfast however was horrid, the buffet was fine but we made the mistake of ordering poached eggs and bacon, truly terrible, inedible, and for 16 euro unacceptable, normally I would have complained, I had a terrible cold and just could not face the hassle. Our first night we had dinner outside on the terrace, I was sorely disappointed, very expensive.So yes all in all excellent location, a pleasant enough room just terrible food. So just dont eat there.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, nice staff and great location but internet charges are expensive”
Reviews.Author: Lillias
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here in two rooms with our two teenagers for a couple of nights en route to the UK. We arrived straight off a long haul flight at 10 am and they had one room available for us immediately and I was very grateful for that. The rooms are very small. I don't normally bother that much about size as you are on holiday and usually out and about but with large suitcases in tow, it actually makes quite a difference. Our second room was avalable about an hour and a half later which was really great. The only drawback was that the rooms weren't near each other. Even though my kids are teenagers, I like our rooms to be nearby, it's much easier when we're sharing suitcases and one night someone tried the door on our room. This was probably another guest who'd made a mistake but at 3 am, if it had been the kids' room, and they aren't next to us, they'd have got a scare. After our early check in, we came back in the evening and our rooms had been cleaned with fresh towels provided since we'd all had showers that morning. A nice surprise. The hotel is really nicely decorated, all the staff are very nice and very helpful and the location is excellent. The drawbacks are that the rooms are small, as previously mentioned and there was no tea/coffee making facilities in our rooms and the mini bar was expensive, as is usually the case in hotels (over 3 euros for a small bottle of water). My big complaint is the internet charges. This is an expensive hotel, so I do think it should be complimentary. I was told I could have one hour free on the lobby computer for the length of our stay (even though we had 2 rooms). This wasn't very good as apart from anything else, I couldn't access Facebook and it took up valuable time trying to get around in Spanish. I decided to buy internet access for our room which was 15 euros for 24 hours and it was pointed out to me that this was continuous and not 24 hours in total use. Plus it was only for one device (we have 2 ipads) Some might say you're on holiday and don't need Facebook etc but I was trying to contact friends who were also in Barcelona, trying to make bookings for the next part of our trip and trying to check on bank card statements that were on Australia time, never mind 2 teenagers who love their Facebook. All in all, I liked this hotel. If it had internet included I would definitely stay again if I were ever visiting the beautiful city of Barcelona. One tip is be careful when the hotel orders you a taxi. Though no fault of the hotel, I didn't realise that the taxi meters start the minute you call them and we got stung for 45 euros for a taxi to the airport, when it only cost us 29 euros in the other direction. There's plenty outside in the street to just grab one.

Reviews.Title: “I recommend it for its modern style & for its location next to subway station (Diagonal) but not for their service.”
Reviews.Author: Engaa
Reviews.Content: I recommend it for its modern style & for its location next to subway station (Diagonal). Lightening in the rooms are so creative and has many options like ( relax, welcoming and ambition) Reception did a reservation for us in a good Mexican restaurant :) note: when we ordered hot water at 7:30 a.m we were told that the service will charge u for 5 Eur which is not fair comparing to other hotels where they offer heater for water,

Reviews.Title: “Overrated. Overprized. Lacks the details.”
Reviews.Author: Alecprime
Reviews.Content: The Murmuri at first seems to be like a great place to spend a couple of days in Barcelona. The location is perfect, cannot be any more central than here. However, there are some mayor drawbacks that make it impossible to recommend the hotel to someone else. First, the regular ("superior") rooms are horrible, Marriot-like chambers with no space, and some even lack a sight (there is a window, that opens to a wall with pipes and electricity, you dont see the sky though). Nevertheless these "chambers" still cost 120 Euro a night. We asked for an upgrade and took the "Priviliged" Room. These rooms are alright, ours had a little terasse, nice bath (no bathtub though), small mini bar, small flat TV (No HDTV). Well, the rate for this room was 220 Euro, which is ridiculously overpriced. Plus, the free Wifi that was promised in the reservations does not apply for the top rooms! Its another 10 Euro for 24 hours. For a hotel claiming to have four stars, this is simply unacceptable. Further drawbacks: There is no spa in the hotel, no sauna or steambath. You can walk to the sister hotel for a treatment... In summary, the murmuri reminds me of a woman with too much make up, that tries to cover its deficiencies under a pile of want-to-be-glam. Three points, since the staff, at least, was very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Well kept secret in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: marianne a
Reviews.Content: Friends and I were delighted with this find in Barcelonal. Centrally located, but just enough off the "path" to offer quiet nights and safety. The staff is very accomodating, nelpful and friendly to language challenged guests. Breakfasts are terrific offering superb breads/sweet pastries, along with meats & cheeses, eggs, coffee and teas; then, you can request cooked-to-order directly from the kitchen for a few eruos more than the standard breakfast fare. Rooms are very clean and large with a neat seating area/balcony with windows overlooking interesting housing and roof top gardens. We enjoyed watching waiters from a nearby restaurant take their "smoke breaks" on the roof of one building. They were telling jokes, laughing, smoking and in general having a great time on their break. Fun to see, even if we couldn't hear them.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel,great location.”
Reviews.Author: harrybBunbury
Reviews.Content: Great Small hotel,Pleasant & helpful staff,comfortable beds and rooms.Best Location in Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Apartment hotel”
Reviews.Author: RoboRuth
Reviews.Content: We had a very spacious, ultra-modern, clean 2-BR apartment attached to the Murmuri Hotel for 439Euro/night. It had a kitchen (with dishes) and a large deck (with deck lounges and table-and-chair set). View out the back is nothing to write home about, but the apartment was quiet and centrally-located. Internet use was only 10Euro for 24 hr. Hotel has a lovely bar and small restaurant, and there are plenty more to choose from in the neighbourhood. Would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Lots of positives but a few noteworthy minuses”
Reviews.Author: TxTree
Reviews.Content: My family and I recently stayed for five nights in one of the 2 bedroom apartments (Liceu). There are lots of reasons to like this hotel, but a couple of annoyances kept me from loving it. First, the big plusses. The location is absolutely fantastic: right on the Rambla de Catalunya, near the metro, shopping, restaurants, and just a few blocks from Casa Pedredra and Casa Batllo. Really convenient and lovely. The apartment itself was spacious and comfortable, with a beautiful terrace. The hotel staff were very nice and accommodating. The bar was fabulous. And it was great to have access to the very nice Hotel Majestic fitness/swim facilities. Now, the big minus. It seems that there is a restaurant kitchen just below the Liceu apartment, and we were kept awake (or were awakened) by crazy restaurant and kitchen noises, including most irritatingly a regular "thump" sound - maybe a swinging door? - that echoed throughout the apartment every minute or two. It wasn't so bad on Wednesday and Thursday nights. But Friday, Saturday and Sunday were really bad, and went until 1:30 a.m. The front desk claimed no one else had complained about the noise, but I find that hard to believe. A couple more quibbles. WiFi. As many others have noted, there isn't free wifi in the rooms. The hotel is moving in the right direction by offering free wifi in the lobby. But this seems hardly adequate. Sure, I'm on vacation, but I want internet access to be able to book tickets online, research restaurants, check flights, etc. (never mind about work). I don't understand why the hotel can't fix this issue. Coffee. The apartment came equipped with a nespresso machine. Which was great. Except that there were only a few nespresso capsules provided and we didn't realize (because no one told us) that even these were not replenished daily. We were supposed to scout out nespresso capsules during our vacation in Barcelona? That seemed really silly. Someone eventually brought us additional capsules (thank you!) but only after I complained and only the next afternoon. I do hope to return to Barcelona soon and I would stay at Murmuri again if I didn't have to deal with these issues.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: mumiller1
Reviews.Content: My husband, another couple and I stayed here on our last night in Barcelona. It was our favorite hotel the entire stay. It's in a wonderful location-close to dining, shopping and Gaudi architecture. The staff is extremely welcoming and helpful. The rooms are small and clean, but make the most of their space. We ate dinner at the restaurant in the hotel our first day there and it was delicious. We would definitely stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Staff and Service excel at this Barcelona Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Kendotm
Reviews.Content: A well trained attendant staff makes our 5 night stay on the Rambla Catalunya as delightful as expected and much more. The receptionists/ hosts seemed to eagerly answer your queries regarding diner, sightseeing, transportation options and all of your needs in a quite professional manner; and always utilizing custom marked maps highlighting your needs. The bar was well manned and intimate. The area surrounding the hotel offers fabulous Tapas and Catalan diner options, chocolate shops and local breakfast at cafe Francesco around the corner had great fresh squeezed OJ, cafe cafe con lesche and a traditional ham or veggie sandwiches. Location ideal for all public transportation including the Aerobus from the airport. Props to Maria C, Roberto, the movie star look-a-like, Frank, and Nick.

Reviews.Title: “Without hesitation”
Reviews.Author: dtvl
Reviews.Content: Great stay for two nights post a Med cruise. The Privilege Double room was large w king bed & very comfy. Bathroom offered all the comforts of home: clean, robes, slippers. Street noise on a Friday night wasn't too disturbing. Hotel bar is very pricy. Cafe Mauri around the corner is great for a snack/coffee, tea, etc. Enjoy the city and walk your legs off!

Reviews.Title: “Meet expectations”
Reviews.Author: Petracca
Reviews.Content: The location was good if you prefer to be away from the hustle & bustle of la ramblas. Very expensive to eat & drink at the hotel bar & restaurant, however why would you when there are so many outside your door. Room was clean & looked like the photos however quite small. Internet was in Spanish only

Reviews.Title: “Charming and Welcoming”
Reviews.Author: DandDToronto
Reviews.Content: The best hotel of our two-week visit to Spain. We had a good-sized room overlooking Rambla de Catalunya: a lovely view over a busy avenue but no noise due to excellent soundproofing. The room decor was top notch in both quality, practicality and style. Special mention must be made of the cleaning staff who left our room in perfect condition every day. In fact, staff throughout the hotel were all very good and spoke excellent English. As mentioned by a previoius reviewer, the temperature of the shower water was uneven. Loved the lighting system which set the room up with different moods. Breakfast was good although, given the cost of staying here, an additional price for a cooked breakfast was a surprise. The bar was too noisy for us with loud piped "music". The outdoor cafe was pleasant but the service erratic. It appeared that there was only a single English language newspaper in the lobby each day; a common problem at Spanish hotels which we did not expect here. The location of the hotel is perfect. A charming area away from the hustle of the city centre but within easy reach of evetything.

Reviews.Title: “We were WOW'd right from the beginning!”
Reviews.Author: Luttrell
Reviews.Content: First off, the staff at Hotel Mur Muri is fantastic! My wife and I arrived at the hotel early (10am) and I knew that check in wasn't until 3pm. I asked the ladies at the reception desk if by chance they had a room available. They informed us a room was available and we were welcome to check in early. Music to our ears considering the experience we had with another hotel in Barcelona one week prior. From the moment we walked into the hotel, we were WOW'd. From the decor to the friendly staff (who informed us that they had upgraded our room), and the attention to detail in our room. The bed was extremely comfortable - wonderful pillows - bathroom fantastic - large, plush bathroom towels - warm colors - very, very nice. Hotel Mur Muri is in a great location as well. Right out the door you'll find great restaurants, fantastic shopping and tours of Barcelona (the hotel staff can sell you tour tickets at the front desk). Hotel Mur Muri has a bar that is a great place to have a glass of Spanish wine. Don't miss it. But rarely do you find this kind of personal service. The morning we were leaving, I wanted a cup of Starbucks coffee (which is only 1 block away). It was early and to my dismay, Starbucks had not opened. As I was walking back through the lobby, I asked the staff what time Starbucks opened and was told around 9:30. Mentioned that I really wanted a cup of coffee but oh well...I'll just have to do without. At that moment, one of the staff said - "I'll go into the bar and make you a cup". WOW! Within 5 minutes, he made me the best cup of cappuccino...it was perfect. What GREAT service! I highly recommend you make Hotel Mur Muri your hotel of choice in Barcelona. Don't miss this hotel - it's splendid.

Reviews.Title: “Good central location, overall very good”
Reviews.Author: Peter G
Reviews.Content: Hotel Murmuri is probably 15-20 minutes walk from the Placa de Catalunya, and all around are great shops and restaurants. It's alos close to the hop-on/hop-off tourist buses. The room was quite nice, although there wasn't much room to put the bags. The bed on the other hand was ridiculously large - I would have preferred a smaller bed and more floorspace! We stayed for 3 days prior to our cruise, and were upgraded to a bigger room the second time we stayed after the cruise. The staff were all pretty helpful. The only thing that let it down for me was the internet access. The wifi didn't work in either room, and we use it when travelling to Skype the kids and grandkids at home. We had to go down to the fixed computers on the first floor, and then of course we couldn't use Skype. On top of that we had to pay extra to use the internet, and this was the first hotel we stayed at in Europe where it wasn't free (though far from the cheapest!). Apparently their internet is subcontracted to another company, and their service sucks! The staff were apologetic and clearly could do nothing to help, but it detracted from our stay. Starbucks is around the corner and for the price of a cup of coffee you get 45 minutes of internet access included!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: RonanJC
Reviews.Content: Would highly recommend this hotel as it ticks all the boxes. Its in a great location with the Diagonal Metro stop just around the corner which serves the 2 lines that run to all the main tourist attractions. It has loads of little cafes and eateries for all tastes close by. We did not deal with the staff much but they were very friendly and courteous when we did. The apartment was modern and chic and the bed was the most comfortable I have ever slept in. All in all the perfect experience.

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommended”
Reviews.Author: nandm1388
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights at Mur Muri and must say that the room and especially the service we got was exceptional! It's a pretty cool hotel with all the trimmings you would expect from a 5 star. A special thank you to Francesco at reception who went out of his way to help us from finding our power adaptor which we accidently left behind to securing accommodation at our next stop in Costa Brava. Excellent work guys! Will recommend this hotel to our friends most definitely!

Reviews.Title: “A great way to stay in barcelona”
Reviews.Author: hseofbel
Reviews.Content: wish you had your own place, your own apt in barcelona...well you can the hotel Murmuri has apts lofts that are great. we were three traveling and it worked out great, with a kitchen, washer and reg size fridge....no better stay. We were fortunate to have Francesco as our captain on the sailing cruise he arranged...see him -- he is a master at getting your needs met... Francesco...send the pictures please!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good location, BUT not so good service”
Reviews.Author: eeheeh C
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at Murmuri with my sisters for 4 nights and chose this hotel mainly for its location and that it received decent ranking from tripadvisor. I normally use trip advisor to choose hotels because it is generally accurate and had really good experience through its recommendations. Given that the room rate is quite high at ~US$320 per night (we even booked 1.5 month in advance) for a 2 person room and that it is situated in one of the best neighborhoods in Barcelona, we expected service to be just as good. However, the service was a disaster and here are a few bad experience that we experienced. I have never complained on trip advisor, but really feel I should this time since I don't want any reviewers to stay there without knowing the following: - Upon check in, they gave me a room located on the 1st floor. Given that I am a light sleeper, I asked to change room to a higher floor. The manager that was serving me literally rolled her eyes and said "no", with no further explanation. Afterwards, the male staff standing next to the manager took over and suggested and magically found me a room. Just surprised me that the staff was more nice than the manager. Perhaps it's an European thing. - They are extremely understaffed and don't think they even have room service reps. When i asked for hotel slippers, the check in rep came to my door with the slippers. Very odd. - A few days later, my sister called the concierge (which also happens to be the same check in rep) to ask for recommendation on restaurants and she asked my sister to call back later because she is busy. I've never been asked to "call back later" by a concierge, not even when I stayed at Best Western etc. - I had originally prepaid for the first night through an online booking agency. When I was checking out, they said they never got the prepayment from the agency (very large agency) even though I provided the confirmation. They later acknowledged the confirmation but still asked me to pay in full and that they will later credit the amount back to me once their accounting office is open again (I checked out on a Sat). I told them that I don't live in Europe so it will be difficult to communicate later should I not receive the credit. They weren't happy that I refused to pay extra, literally. - After the check out dilema, I asked to leave my suitcase and to pick it up when I head to airport later that evening. When I went back for my suitcase, it was right in the middle of the lobby where I have left it hours ago. Some safe keeping there!! - Also, don't get worked up with the gym that they offer at another sister hotel (Hotel Majestic) because it is really not worth walking 2-3 blocks. It's tiny and the shower is horrible, worse than my high school gym and locker room (from 10+ years back). Perhaps others experienced better times at Murmuri but I definitely will not return there. This hotel is definitely not worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “Recommended”
Reviews.Author: kdc4
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a nice, 5th fl superior room. Great view of the street and very comfortable yet modern furnishings in the room. The hotel is one block off of Pl de Gracia and generally well situated. Got a nice bottle of cava as a surprise welcome gift. Lovely touch. Would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent - a top quality hotel in every way”
Reviews.Author: gloucesterbloke
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed in the Murmuri 6-9 September for our wedding anniversary. The hotel is stylish, the rooms are very well finished, and the aircon is excellent - important in Barcelona ! The hotel staff were just the best - polite, helpful, and very knowledgeable about all things Barca. The location is possibly the best bit of all - less than 10 mins walk from the top of La Ramblas, but far enough from the mass crowds, and in a very smart part of Barca - great shops, street cafes and restaurants from right outside the door. Final tip - the Murmuri has it's own pavement restaurant outside the front on Pl. de Catalunya - and it is excellent. We've travelled a lot over the years, and you expect to have to make some compromises each time, but this hotel is top quality, without exception.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location!”
Reviews.Author: Eliza53
Reviews.Content: We spent six nights at Hotel Murmuri and it was a very nice staying. Pros: 1-The staff is very polite and always helpful, ready to give you information, directions, suggestions, etc - this is a major point for us while choosing a hotel. 2- The hotel is very clean and the room, although very small, was nicely appointed. Very comfortable bed and good bathroom . We took a privilege room with a private terrace ( room 603)- it is incredible tiny! It is difficult for two people to move around the room and the luggage block your passage. The door that leads to the terrace doesn´t open wide because the bed is too close to it. The front desk woman did warned me about the size of the room and offered as an alternative to take a privilege room without the terrace, which is indeed much better in terms of space. We refused because we wanted the terrace. If you don´t mind the terrace, pick this one without the terrace. 3- Location could not be better. The hotel is in a neighborhood called Eixample, which is very nice, safe and with lots of good restaurants, bar and upscale stores. It is in Rambla de Caltalunya ( don´t mistake it by Las Ramblas, which is noisy, crowded and dangerous). From the hotel you can walk to the the historic center, a nice walking , take a bus or metro. There are bus stops and a metro station (Diagonal) a block away. Hop on hop off buses also have their stops a block from the hotel. The hotel is a block from Paseig del Gracia which is a beautiful avenue, with its high-end stores and nice bars. You are a block from La Pedrera ( Casa Mila) and a few blocks from Casa Batlo, Gaudí´s wonderful buildings. 4- We didn´t try Restaurant Murmuri because somehow it didn´t attracted us, but in our way back to the hotel we always stopped at Terraza Bar Marfil for a few drinks and tapas ( a nice outside area on the avenue, good for watching the movement ). Good service. CONS: 1- The breakfast is far below reasonable. Few options, very poor buffet, terrible coffee. If you ask for anything cooked like a simple omelete you have to wait for a long time. The service is terrible, the staff here doesn´t speak English and it is not properly trained. They don´t clean the tables right after the customers leaving which leaves the general impression of a very dirty place. Sometimes the cups and cutlery are dirty. You get the feeling that the breakfast area doesn´t belong to the hotel and complaints are just ignored. That is the only point why I am giving this hotel a 4 stars instead of 5. However, right around the corner you have an excellent pastry called Mauri, where you may a have a very good breakfast. 2- Internet at 15 euros/day.

Reviews.Title: “Peaceul retreat in the center of downtown”
Reviews.Author: TheFoliage
Reviews.Content: We selected this hotel for our honeymoon in Barcelona, and we were looking for two things: central location where we could get to everything, and a quiet, secluded room to escape. Murmuri blew us away on both counts, and threw in a couple of surprises as well! Our room had a balcony overlooking one of the main streets in the city. It was small, but perfect for sitting out with a drink and watching urban life from a 4th story perch. When we came inside and closed the balcony door, it felt as quiet and peaceful as a private getaway - not a sound from outside - it was amazing! Close the blackout curtains and you wouldn't even know that there was a city outside your window. Now that would have been plenty for me to write a glowing review - but Murmuri deserves exceptional recognition for going above and beyond. The room and all public areas were immaculately clean, the staff was always friendly and helpful, our room was cleaned every day no matter what time we left the room, and they surprised us with a complimentary bottle of champagne and a fruit plate our first night there to welcome us to their hotel and to the city. I do agree with some of the other reviews, that I was disappointed they did not offer free wi-fi. But that would be my only gripe. We were halfway across the world, in a foreign city that speaks two largely unfamiliar languages, and yet this hotel felt like home. After a long day exploring the nooks and crannies of beautiful Barcelona, I was always happy to see the great front door of Murmuri. I would recommend this hotel to anyone looking to be right in the thick of things, but who wants a place to escape when they need a break from the city and a good night's sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: booknerdEngland
Reviews.Content: I stayed here recently with my daughter who was taking a break from interrailing around Europe. We had a classic/standard twin room with beds touching. The room was indeed v small and at the back of the hotel overlooking roofs, a basketball court and residential properties. So, not a great view, but surprisingly quiet, even with the window open. There was a flat screen TV which appeared to show only Spanish progs (mainly football), but not an issue with us. The furnishings were stylish and clean, but the black furniture was beginning to look a little worn. Disappointingly we only had a shower, but this was probably because we had booked one of the cheaper rooms at Euros 165 per night through hotels.com. The shower cubicle itself was enormous, but its design meant that, instead of water draining through a plug hole, it dripped over the edges and stained the floor of the cubicle. Otherwise, the room and bathroom were v clean and the chambermaids did a good job considering the debris left around the room from my daughter's backpack. (Sorry!) Housekeeping also collected and returned her trousers promptly for cleaning (at Euros 11). The location and stylishness of the hotel are its best bits. It's an easy taxi-ride from the airport at about Euros 27, but also within a stone's throw of the fast, efficient, clean Metro. Along the median running through the boulevard outside (La Rambla de Catalunya) is a succession of restaurants. We tried the recommended Cerveceria Catalanya on the first eve for good tapas, but surly service from a Rowan Atkinson lookalike waiter. El Fornet, just down from the hotel towards Placa de Catalunya, has lovely pastries for breakfast. Also good for dinner was Meson Cinco Jotas nearer the hotel and on the opposite side of the road. We did not try any meals in the hotel itself as it seemed prohibitively expensive and I preferred Spanish food to Asian fusion. But we did treat ourselves to cocktails, which were excellent but dear (Euros 11 for a Martini) and we ended up paying extra for nibbles, which seems a bit mean. We visited Casa Battlo, which is v close, and Parc Guell, which isn't. (Tip: go by Metro; it's a long way on the No.24 bus, although you do get closer to the top). On a wet day, we went to the Picasso Museum to find an enormous queue at 5.00pm. So, even if we'd bothered to stand in line, the museum itself would have been packed. Overall, it was an enjoyable, if expensive trip. Free wi-fi in the hotel would have been so useful for my daughter checking reservations, etc, for her onward journey. The staff were generally most helpful, esp when we wanted to leave our luggage before checking-in and after checking-out. A good hotel if money is no object or for an occasional splurge.

Reviews.Title: “Best Boutique Hotel in Barcelona!”
Reviews.Author: anita b
Reviews.Content: We spent 6 nights in Barcelona and this hotel was one of the highlights of the trip. Roberto and Regina and all of the staff were always smiling and accommodating. The room was beautiful, spacious and sparkly clean! Can't wait to go back!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Up graded”
Reviews.Author: K E
Reviews.Content: My husband and I where staying in Barcelona for one night only. We booked a room at Hotel Inglaterra as we'd stayed there before (excellent hotel). On arrival in Barcelona I was contacted by Inglaterra and informed of a double booking. To compensate us for this mistake we were offered an 'up-grade' to their sister 'Boutique' Hotel Murmuri. Our room in Murmuri was smaller then in Inglaterra, it may have had mood lighting and extra (pointless) fancy pillows, ridiculously low hanging chandeliers and all the bells and whistles one might expect form a 'Boutique' Hotel but I almost felt uncomfortable staying there. The Murmuri bar and local restaurant prices are extortionate. It's a fancy area but if money is an issue, stay at the other end of Plaza de Cataluña. On the plus side the staff where very helpful and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel but missing things from my luggage”
Reviews.Author: ClaraPeter
Reviews.Content: I had a very pleasant stay at this hotel. Comfortable beds and room. When I came home 3 pieces of my clothes were missing! I have a very bad feeling about this.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay.”
Reviews.Author: Angela L
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have just returned from a four night stay at the Hotel Murmuri. We really enjoyed our stay, the room was elegantly designed, the bed was fantastically comfortable and the level of cleanliness impeccable (all bed linen and towels were changed every day). The air conditioning was great and the lighting could be dimmed which was very relaxing at the end of a busy touristy day. The breakfast was delicious and the waitresses were charming. All the staff were helpful, good humoured and prompt to respond to any requests. It was the combination of their friendliness and professionalism that set the hotel apart from other hotels we have stayed at. We felt very welcome and would love to return one day.

Reviews.Title: “Tranquil, Elegant and Well-Located”
Reviews.Author: Di_bigapple
Reviews.Content: We just got back from 4 days in Barcelona and we were extremely pleased with our stay at Hotel Murmuri. The location is perfect and in the nicest neighborhood in Barcelona. Hotel is boutique size, next to a metro stop, 20 minute walk to the Gothic quarter, lots of great restaurants nearby, very safe and elegant area, with the best of Modernist architecture all around you. Staff was very helpful. We had a superior room, which is very quiet; rooms are well-equipped and nice size, as are the bathrooms. The lighting in the room is also very well done with multiple settings for various needs. Rooms have flat screen tvs, ipod dock/clock, ample closet space, a safe and a mini bar.The hotel restaurant is lovely, with a good menu of Asian fusion dishes and fair prices. The only disappointment was that the hotel does not have free WIFI. I also got a good deal by reserving through Tablet Hotels. I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Sieze any opportunity to stay here.”
Reviews.Author: Richard B
Reviews.Content: My wife likes a large space to spread out her makeup and I originally booked the 2 bedroom apartment so we would have two bathrooms. As luck would have it, the apartments air conditioner needed repair and the hotel notified us it wouldn't be ready. Some might argue this was a reason why it was good we used a travel agent. I won't use a travel agent next time but deal directly with the hotel (www.murmuri.com). Their site shows availability and rates that we had to point out to our travel agent, and from our experience with the staff, I have complete faith that we wouldn't have arrived to any unpleasant surprise. We wound up in the one bedroom apartment Romea. It is fabulously spacious and has a guest toilet. It also has a combination washer/drier and a nespresso machine. It is noisy at night until you realize that there are electric shutters which come down over the windows (HINT: point this out to the guests). The Murmuri is very conveniently located; 10 minute walk to Cinc Sentits (as wonderful for food as the Murmuri is for lodging - we had lunch the 1st day here) and the Hoffman (we had an excellent dinner the following night), 5 minute walk to Mary's Market (Valencia) and Cerveceria Catalana (Mallorca), and a 2 minute walk to the Metro line 3 There is a connection from various metro lines to line 3 at Passage de Garcia. It is a very long walk. WIFI from the Murmuri is expensive. Buy a microsim card around the corner on Provenca from orange. (Before leaving get a microsim to sim holder if you need one.) 3.5 Euros for 24 hours or 35 Euros for a month. Next time I won't try to buy sim cards in the states (Happy worked for voice not data), I will bring a small packet of laundry soap, I might bring a stick of nespresso although there store is very close at Gracia and Valencia and I will deal directly with TraficoBCN@aerocity.com for transfers between the hotel and airport. I also will pay very close attention to the type of plane and might adjust the visit around availability. The Airbus 320 1st class from SFO to PHL was good in terms of comfort, food, and service; the 330-200 Envoy class from PHL to BCN was luxurious in terms of comfort, food, and service; whatever Airbus we had from BCN to PHL was mediocre in terms of comfort and horrid in food; the 321 from PHL to SFO was at best fair in comfort but fair in food.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent boutique hotel in a great part of town”
Reviews.Author: LATraveler90046
Reviews.Content: If you're considering the MurMuri, book it and feel good about it. The hotel and rooms are well appointed, and the staff is overall very friendly. The hotel is in a great part of town, close enough to great shopping, architecture, very central to plenty of restaurants. It's close to one of the Red Barcelona City Tour Bus stops (highly recommended, too). But, it feels just slightly removed from some of the hustle and bustle, although there's plenty going on nearby.. Perfect choice. Downside- no pool, and no free wifi (can pay, but it's pricey). Can use pool at nearby Majestic, and go to the Starbucks around the corner for 45 free minutes of wifi. Also, the Boca Grande restaurant around the corner looks great!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and design but wifi was a ripoff”
Reviews.Author: dovebvi
Reviews.Content: My husband & I stayed in Hotel Murmuri at the end of August. Our room was small, but nicely designed. If we had stayed more than two nights I think space would have been an issue, but it worked okay for us. I was wishing that we had upgraded to a larger room and would probably suggest this to anyone else booking. The bathroom was fab and I loved the large shower. The hotel is in a great location- close to lots of restaurants and shopping but away from the really touristy areas. My main gripe was the RIDICULOUS charge for wifi- it came out to nine euros for 45 minutes (they actually add tax to the charge so that is the total). The hotel isn't cheap and any decent hotel that I have ever stayed in in that price range has offered free wifi. We stayed at the gorgeous Viceroy in Miami a week later and not only did we get free wifi, but our room was three times the size and about two thirds of the price of the Murmuri. I think that it is tacky for a hotel of this standard to charge such a rate for wifi. One of the restaurants we went into for lunch had free wifi so why on earth wouldn't a 200 euro a night hotel offer it? It makes it very clear that they aren't attracting business oriented clinetele. I also have to agree with another reviewer about being pushed to do the tacky bus tours around the city. I think the front desk staff must be on comission because we got a 10 minute spiel about the bus tour and were really pressured to book a two day tour! I would imagine that most of the clientele that stays in this gorgeous boutiqe hotel would be too sophisticated to be interested, it seemed quite unusual. To sum up I would say that the hotel is beautiful and well located, maybe the management should just re-examine some of the smaller details that takes away from this truly being the high end boutique hotel that it should be.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed in Two Bedroom Murmuri Residence Apartments - Very Nice”
Reviews.Author: ensco3
Reviews.Content: We stayed for two nights in the suites that are part of the Murmuri (they are about 50 meters down the laneway adjacent to the hotel. Very nice, with a lovely patio. Would have got a 5 star from us but for some odd service issues (only two towels provided for a group of six, long wait when we requested more, kitchen was missing basic items eg tea towels, dishwasher soap etc). Would consider again, as hotel was clean/beautiful, and very central.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Peter S
Reviews.Content: Our family had two rooms and totally enjoyed our stay at this hotel. The location was great - our rooms were very clean and comfortable. The staff was very helpful, knowledgeable and courteous. Definitely recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “A Lot to Like”
Reviews.Author: HonkHonk
Reviews.Content: The Murmuri Hotel is an excellent choice in the Rambla area of Barcelona. It is a small boutique on the far north end of Rambla de Catalunya, close to the action but in a much quieter area; a perfect location actually. Though I was there for business, I was impressed by all the shopping, dining, and nightlife around the hotel. My room was comfortable, reasonably large, clean, and well equipped with plenty of closet and drawer space, robes, slippers, safe (large enough for a laptop), minibar, hair dryer, toiletries, and other amenities you would expect a good hotel to provide. My room was on the fourth floor facing Rambla, but I was not disturbed by street noise. The room also had a cool little balcony with chairs. High points: * An iPod dock, which was convenient and could be used as a wake-up alarm. * The room had a fairly sophisticated lighting system that allowed several different settings for different moods and uses. * Wireless internet was no charge – at least for me. My colleagues were unable to find a complimentary connection. * The air conditioning was superb. I was able to get the room down to about 19C/66F. This is a particular concern for me in European hotels, where air conditioning often seems more like an after-thought and I end up sleeping poorly because of a hot, stuffy room. Downsides: * The bathroom had a variety of hair plastered to the sink, tub, etc. The tub had some grunge that was not very attractive. Otherwise, the room and common areas were clean and appeared well maintained. * My room rate did not include breakfast but given that my room rate was only 157€, I would not really expect it. However, there was no in-room coffee either and this was inconvenient in the mornings. Nevertheless, they did offer breakfast at 12€ if (I think) I agreed to buy it for each day of the stay. I declined, but this was a pretty good offer considering many hotels want as much as 30€ for breakfast. I was very pleased with the Murmuri and I definitely recommend it when in Barcelona for business or pleasure. Hope this helps. .

Reviews.Title: “Elegance and Style”
Reviews.Author: IreneBlag
Reviews.Content: Style is the first association with Murmuri hotel. Every single detail corresponds to that: room design, decoration of the hall or pillows, breakfast service, even receptionists’ appearance and manners. We stayed in Romea – 2-bedroom apartment with 2 baths and fully-equipped kitchen including coffee-machine provided with coffee-capsules. The washing-machine was most convenient; Barcelona was the 2nd city on the trip, so our stuff needed washing. We were granted a gift voucher to enjoy their restaurant gastronomy with a 15% discount. Separate thanks are to Gaspar and Francisco who were most welcoming guys on the reception. Thank you all! Oh, the wooden floor in the shower was a special treat!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, comfortable acommodations.”
Reviews.Author: southpasstiger
Reviews.Content: Great location in the center of the city. Rooms were well-appointed. Staff was very helpful and courteous. Big fan.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely boutique hotel!!!!”
Reviews.Author: beth06
Reviews.Content: Our family had 2 rooms for one week and we thoroughly enjoyed it...one room was a bit smaller-2 beds for the kids, and the larger room with one bed. Both were very nicely appointed and quite comfortable. The location cannot be beat...beautiful cafes and restaurants all around and easy walking distance to most of the city. The concierge staff was great and recommended lots of great restaurants. We also did a fat tire bike tour of the city which was a highlight of our stay in Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “A lovely boutique hotel in the center of Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: RIPEPINEAPPLE
Reviews.Content: I stayed a week here,on business, and didn't get tired of comfy little boutique hotel in the center of lively Barcelona. Great design, everything is in the right place,great bathroom with both bathtub and shower cabin . A lovely bar downstairs is open day&night, perfect breakfast with hamon and brut cava included. The location is ideal for shopping and sightseeing, but nothing like crowded and littered Rambla streets, all you can wish for to enjoy this grand city!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Stay!”
Reviews.Author: SMK77
Reviews.Content: Spent two nights in their Deluxe Suite and I am coming back for more! Wonderful property, great interior design, fantastic front desk. Location is also very good and the additional facilities at their partner hotel come in handy. I am usually very loyal with Hyatt but as there is no Hyatt in Barcelona, I was looking for an luxury getaway in the city - and I found it. Highly recommended! Internet connection was the only minus - didn't like the slow connectivity by a third party provider which is charging 15 EUR a day.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel, great location in the middle of everything you could wish to visit with excellent service”
Reviews.Author: ForestFan1001
