Reviews.Content: Booked the Hotel for 2 nights in early August for a family visit to Barcelona. Everything about the Hotel was excellent; rooms, service, decor & staff. I have stayed in many Hotels around the world over many years & these are THE most comfortable beds, ever.

Reviews.Title: “Truly wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: Dolldie
Reviews.Content: We have just got home from a absolutely wonderful stay at the MurMuri. Beautiful hotel in a lovely location. The are was not as busy as some of the more central area's but it was such a plus that after fighting crowds at all the tourist attractions all day you could come home to a beautiful relaxed area. Great access to the Metro with Diagonal station practically outside the hotel door. The staff were so friendly and helpful. They helped us book tickets to go see an amazing Flamenco show and gave us great advice on planning days out. All the staff spoke beautiful english. We will definitely be back for another visit! My only slight criticism was that there was not any wi-fi available which was a bit inconvenient but not the end of the world.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel - a must for a special weekend!”
Reviews.Author: 00_traveller_00
Reviews.Content: Superb hotel and outstanding service from the friendly and knowledgable staff. We stayed in a superior room for 4 nights and was impressed at the quality for 115 euro a night. Location is great, as it is walkable to everywhere, but not too close to the booze crews of the Ramblas. The staff really know the city and recommend great locations for food, drink and sightseeing. The rooms are excellently appointed, with every detail considered. We didn't eat there, but enjoyed a drink in the comfortable and stylish bar. Use of the spa and rooftop pool at the sister hotel (Majestic) was a nice bonus. Murmuri really is a 5* experience.

Reviews.Title: “A great central hotel, away from the Ramblas crowds”
Reviews.Author: robcan88
Reviews.Content: Away from the constant swell of people on the Ramblas south of Pla Catalunya this hotel is convenient placed close to metro Diagonal on the Rmbla de Catalunya (~10 mins walk). Very convenientty placed for the Manzana de Discordia, Casa Batló, La Pedrera, Sagarda Familia, Tapiés museum, and also the less well known but highly recommended Fundacio Godia (Carrer Disputacio). Francesco on the front desk was very helpful and knowledgable; if you require suggestions for things to do he is your man. Rooms are large and comfortable and bathrooms are well designed, clean, and showers have a good strong jet. We ate in the restaturant ajoining the hotel one evening and were pleasantly suprised by the food quality. All in all a very enjoyable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Service is fantastic”
Reviews.Author: vindoc2000
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a day. Boutique hotel in a very upmarket street. Great bar and the rooms were very comfy with clean showers. Step out of the hotel and there are restaurants everywhere. The service deserves a special mention. They were efficient and fantastic. Go for it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Self-Catering Apartment”
Reviews.Author: Toute_le_Monde
Reviews.Content: We stayed in one of the apartments as a family of four for two nights. Terrific. Really worked for us. Had two bedrooms (queen and two singles) plus dining area, sitting room, kitchen (with laundry) and a great balcony. The apartment was spacious, clean and chic. Intranet was an additional cost . Service and staff were great. The location is great. It is a relatively long walk to the Rambla and Barri Gotic, but the walk is doable. The trade-off for the long walk to the very touristy areas is that you are not staying in the very touristy areas. You are staying in the well-to-do boutique area. It worked for us. We would definitely stay at the Murmuri again. First rate boutique hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely boutique hotel, clean chic and excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Shellfisk
Reviews.Content: Location:on rambla catalunya surrounded by shops and restaurants and cafes (go for taller the tapas, a 5 min walk from the hotel) Room: clean chic in black and white. If u booked a privileged room make sure u get a king size bed instead of two single beds. Bad amenities causing allergies, unfortunately Molton brown seemed to be a victim of cost cutting. Bar:friendly but slow service,rather expensive compared to other bars in the area Service/front desk:ask Francesco for a restaurant recommendation if u are looking for seafood or Catalan cuisine.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best hotels I've stayed in”
Reviews.Author: DinahTravels
Reviews.Content: We were SO pleased with this hotel. Simple, modern design focused on comfort in probably the best location of the city. The staff were incredibly helpful organizing reservations, assisting with parking and generally making our stay as easy and comfortable as possible. If you stay, be sure to visit Mauri, which is a few doors away, for the set lunch menu and delicious pastries. Thanks Murmuri!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel in Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: Jules1277
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Murmuri for a Company celebration trip for 19 people... the group had a fantastic time and some have even rebooked to come back to the Murmuri later this year... Hotel staff and general ambience, along with beautiful rooms helped make the trip a very special one... the food and drinks were fantastic and we would highly recommend that if travelling to Barcelona you book a room at the Murmuri. The location is perfect - stepping right outside to all the beautiful shops and restaurants...

Reviews.Title: “Good location, nice people, great design”
Reviews.Author: Rodolphe
Reviews.Content: Great design hotel in the heart of shopping and business district, 15 walk to Gothic Quarter and very near to public transportation. Great young staff, very helpful, Manager Maria does a really good job

Reviews.Title: “PERFECT BOUTIQUE HOTEL&GREAT LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: CozSydney
Reviews.Content: Absolutely couldn't fault anything about this hotel. Loved the location as it was in a quieter part of town with some FANTASTIC restaurants close by. The staff were really helpful with restaurant recommendations including Cerveseria Catalina which is about 5min walk from the hotel. (we ate here 3 times in four days!) The rooms were extremely generous in size, immaculate, great furniture, big bathroom, loved everything about the room!!! Loved this hotel and would highly recommend staying here to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: kvrn84
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel in the heart of the Ramblas Catalunya and walking distance from Paseo de Gracia, which is a street over, and the Ramblas. Casa Mila is actually like a two minute walk from the hotel and so is the most expensive street in Spain. Moving on to the hotel, the entrance is lovely with soft colors and modern art. We stayed in a junior suite, which was beautiful, but small. I expected that considering that is the middle of the city. The bed was so soft and heavenly, the only complain is that the King bed is actually two twin bed put together so whenever we moved the beds would move apart since they had wheels. The bathroom was nice, but the shower had half a glass wall with no door to close so when I showered the floor would always get wet and the tub had no friction so I almost slip every time. The staff was very friendly and helpful, no complains there. Even though we were in the middle of a busy street we did not hear any noise during the day or night. We had a balcony, but the view was of the back alley and not that great so if I stay there again I would not get a balcony again is not really worth it. Our stay included breakfast; which was ok, but it was better than spending money every morning somewhere outside because the expenses adds up. Overall, great stay and would stay there again in a heartbeat; I definitely recommend it to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Chic hotel in a great neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: paige_davis24
Reviews.Content: The Murmuri is a fabulous little hotel situated in a great part of Barcelona - just steps from La Pedrera, Casa Batllo and other spots, and an easy walk down to La Rambla (metro is very accessible as well). Our room had a spacious balcony which we enjoyed after walking around all day. The bed was beyond comfortable, and the bathroom was spacious and sleek. We didn't have much room for our suitcases, although there were 2 small wardrobes for hanging and storing clothes. While we loved the nice touch of a bottle of cava upon arrival, we were disappointed in the lack of professionalism displayed by the staff. It's almost as if it were a hotel run by very fashion forward and cool teenagers. They lack the experience that you expect from a 4* hotel (They walked into our room despite the "do not disturb sign", randomly came in to "check the mini bar", forgot to call us a taxi for the airport....) I was also surprised to see that most of the staff doesn't speak Spanish (at least as a first language). My husband is from Argentina and I speak fluently, so it was unsettling to have to speak English to the front desk/reception staff. Every time we walked through the lobby it seemed there was another staff member there. Not very consistent. Pros: -Location, room, restaurant (really delicious), design, amenities - guests can use the spa and pool at the Majestic (a 3 block walk) Cons: -Wifi is not free, staff needs better training, nice sun terrace but no pool. Overall I would recommend this hotel and I would return, but with hopes that the staff are trained adequately by then and that maybe they realize if you're going to pay several hundreds of Euros for your stay that wifi should be free!

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: Stew7601
Reviews.Content: We don't normally stay in these kind of "chic" hotels, but we got a GREAT deal on their web site (540 EUR for four nights) if you purchased in advance, and we were not disappointed. The service at the front desk is exceptional. All speak very good English, are happy to help with recommendations and reservations. Our room seemed small (other reviews indicate there are much larger ones) but well deigned. Loved the bathroom. And it's a very good, central location for seeing the city. You will not be disappointed. P.S.: No need to buy their expensive breakfast, there are 2 great bakeries around the corner for a quick croissant or brioche.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal appartment in a wonderful city”
Reviews.Author: TravellerSydney6
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a week in the wonderful 2 bed apartment attached to the Hotel. Location is great and the set up of the apartment ideal for a family with 3 teenage children. The apartment is very well equipped and well located for touring and shopping. Great street with lots of activity and things to see. We loved Barcelona, and would go back to Murmuri.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely little boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: khm007
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel for a romantic couple of days away from the kids! It was lovely and the hotel personnel were all very pleasant and helpful. The breakfast was fair, the restaurant served goods food and the bar was very relaxing.

Reviews.Title: “LOVED IT.”
Reviews.Author: 10aldridge
Reviews.Content: I pride myself on doing hours of research prior to our travels. My hours will hopefully pay off for you if we have anything in common and you are very picky. First i don't burn money but i have great taste. I must have certain amenities in a hotel. This one had them all. Murmuri is a best bet and after my trip i am certain of it now. First of all i reviewed all of the neighborhoods and chose L Eixample for location. it was very convenient to food, metro, shopping. While we do not spend too much time in the hotel, i need the luxury. The bed was great, sheets were amazing, pillows perfect. Staff friendly. Quiet on the fourth floor. CLEAN. Great bathroom, great mirror in the bathroom and clean towels daily of course. Turn down service in the room was nice as was the lighting. all in all the room was a ten for the price. Location was a ten as well. it is within a short distance to Casa Mila and all of the upscale retails stores. Great little pastry shop to the right and down the next side street. We had coffee and pastires there every day. Maudi is ok but this was better. We took the Metro to Familia and La Ramba. Easy to get on and off but we did do the tour bus the first day to make our way around the city. Nice to recover from your travel by sitting up top and getting the lay of the city. Not necessary but it helped. We skipped food in LaRamblas and was glad after taking the better advice of the locals. Within walking distance is the Catalana restaurant -by far the best tapas in the city ...you must try the Cabreaos. Try all of their desserts especially the Catalonian Cream. We ate there three times and had completely different meals on every occassion. Sangria is great too as is their local beer Estrella. This too is a short walk from the hotel. The Majestic was rated high on the list in Trip Advisor and is located a few blocks down. I didn't like the big scale of it and the Murmuri is actually owned by the same company...so for a boutique experience and smaller size, this was for me the best. I saw the locations of many of the Trip Advisor options and still would book this site over any that i saw. The photos on the web site are accurate and we had a Superior Room. The LaRambla tended to be a big disney like stroll with hundreds of people which at night would be nothing but noise if you are trying to sleep. If sleep is not an option you are reading the wrong review and you will find many options for less money and more noise. The Murmuri has a sexy bar attached and an upscale restaurant attached. We did not typically eat past nine and this restaurant didn't open till 8. We didn't opt since we had other options. We hit the high spots of the city and glad we checked out Parc Guell with its beautiful gardens. We took a cab since the walk was straight up. Only about 5 euros. We also went up the Columbus column again great views worth it. We did Montjuic via the tour bus and got off for some Sangria at the first stop to catch the view. The Picasso museum did not have his full collection but seeing his first works was very enlightening. Don't go on free days line is crazy. Gaudi's Casa Mila was great doing the tour to the roof. The Familia was sufficient just doing the exterior. The lines were hours long. We took a half day trip to Montserrat and it too was worth the trip. We took the train about an hour out of the city and it stops right at the base of the mountain. Take the cable car to the top. We skipped the three hour line to see the Madonna and instead used our camera zoom to view the small statue from the sanctuary. You can check the weather from a webcam online before you go. If you only have a few days in the city, stick to the old parts of the city if you have not traveled to Rome or Paris. It will be enough to keep you intrigued. When you are leaving, don't forget to appreciate the beautifully designed air terminal. It was an architectural high. The only other mention would be our travel time was in June and the weather was great with no humidity. Trip Advisor comments have always paid off for me so i hope this helps you. This is not Rome but cleaner and you don't have to pay to pee. This is not Paris but the waiters are not snobs and they don't pee on the street. We loved the city, the people, the music, the tapas and sangria at Catalana. Adeu.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, Great location”
Reviews.Author: saintlouisan
Reviews.Content: We stayed for three nights before leaving on a cruise. The room was clean, reasonably large, with nine foot ceilings and a small balcony overlooking the street. Big, newer bathroom with good water pressure. Good linens and towels. Minibar (expensive) but no coffee maker. Flat screen TV, good closet space. Breakfast buffet was so-so, but no worse than many other European hotels. Location is right on the northern extension of La Rambla with many nice shops and eateries nearby. Big Metro station half a block away.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it and we'll be back!”
Reviews.Author: barcel0nal0ver
Reviews.Content: The rooms in the front on the 2nd floor are the roomiest and nicest. The rooms on the 6th floor are much smaller although they have a nice sun deck. Francisco and Roberto at the reception area were fantastic and extremely helpful. I can say enough about Hotel MurMuri.

Reviews.Title: “great place”
Reviews.Author: grahame261
Reviews.Content: we stayed here one night before our cruise fantastic hotel from the minute we arrived porter was great reception reception staff very good and our room was first class only one down side room service was hopeless other than that i would recomend to everyone

Reviews.Title: “Great location, modern design, wonderful staff!”
Reviews.Author: dhlipson
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a three day stay in Barcelona. It was my first visit to Barcelona and I loved the city! Great shopping, arhcitecture, sights with both a cool city scene and a beach! The MurMuri is a modern boutique style hotel with a warm staff. Look for Francesco at the front desk -- a handsome, charming man who is always ready to help ake your stay more enjoyable. If you don't need a handicap room , make sure you let them know. Otherwise, the beds are super comfy and the bathrooms are terrific. Love the shower! The location is perfect. On a charming street full of great shops and one block off the major (and busier) shopping street. One block away from the metro entrance and taxi stand. Can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Delightful!”
Reviews.Author: EastBeachBum
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights prior to a cruise. We arrived before check-in time, and the gentleman at the front desk couldn't have been more accommodating and nice. He took our luggage and when we arrived back at the hotel a few hours later, the luggage was already waiting for us in our room. The room was spacious (by European standards) and had a wonderful large terrace. The room was spotless and well designed, and the bed was very comfortable. The location was excellent, on the "quiet end" of Las Ramblas (an extension thereof). The area was very pedestrian-friendly with plenty of restaurants and shops nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect base for a visit to the sights of Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: DavidSue35
Reviews.Content: This was our base for a 5 day trip to Barcelona - our first - and we couldn't have wished for a better one. From beginning to end the staff were very helpful and kind. The restaurant attached provided a great breakfast (tip - get a rate that includes breakfast) and we had a coupple of very good evening meals there too. The hotel rooms are about what you'd expect for the price, but very comfortable and quiet. It's some way from the Ramblas - and if you want to spend the evening there and roll back into the hotel in the early hours then this probably isn't for you, but if you want somewhere that's an oasis to get back to after a days sightseeing then go for the Murmuri! Very convenient for the Barcelona metro - which we found easy to use - and a short stroll from some of the very best Gaudi houses, and some great shopping! Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Highly disappointed about the long waiting time for a simply food order..”
Reviews.Author: m0nika77
Reviews.Content: Because of the positive hype, the highly recommendations done by friends of mine, I have tried by the last Friday the bar at the ground floor. Have to say that this is a really charming hotel,located in the heart of Barcelona with a lot of character... Even more higher was my disappointment and frustration as I been waiting really long time to get served a simple food order,rice noodles as main and chilled strawberry as desert. I would come back but just because of the friendly and helpful staff in the bar lounge which make my stay highly comfortable. Can not get it in my minds how a high quality product can provide that bad service even though the order has been made out of the busy time, by aprox.11pm. Hope deeply that you can work on it...

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel, In the Heart of it All”
Reviews.Author: POSitiveBrett
Reviews.Content: Excellent boutique hotel located in the heart of everything that is Barcelona. Within a short walk of several great Gaudí sites, including La Pedrera and Sagrada Familia, and Plaça Catalunya. We also walked down to La Rambla, which was well worth the extra distance, though Rambla Catalunya was just as nice, and less busy. The hotel is very modern with a fantastic bar and restaurant (they also extend the bar out onto the Rambla in front, which is really nice for people watching). We were very impressed with the staff, and the service we received... they had taxis scheduled and waiting when we needed, and were helpful in every way. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great Choice”
Reviews.Author: MLAMJMB
Reviews.Content: Fantastically located boutique hotel in the midst of what Barcelona offers best - historical sites, cultural centers, restaurants and shopping. Along the Rambla de Catalunya in easy walking distance from everything that counts. Modern, very well-decorated, comfortable, clean and willing-to-help staff. Breakfast very good. Highly recommended

Reviews.Title: “Best of Barcelona!”
Reviews.Author: cooks2
Reviews.Content: We just came from a great hotel in Madrid and yes the Murmuri topped even that. The manager Maria made sure as did her staff that every detail was attended too. We had the time of our life with the help of Roberto and the entire staff. Newspapers to cream for our coffee and salt needed to fix our son and his roommate dinner, getting us what we couldn't find was a pleasure not an imposition. Our son was studying in Barcelona and they thoughtfully suggested staying at the apt. that is part of the hotel instead of our reserved room. How great was that, what a great place it was. Thank you to all the staff for making our trip truly a great one.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: NYdodger31
Reviews.Content: This hotel has an excellent location, staff, and price for what it offers. It was extremely comfortable stay with everyone at the hotel extremely helpful to my wife and I. The room was not large by any standards, but very comfortable with a spectacular balcony and view of the city. So close to everything I would def go back!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great room and fantastic coffee!”
Reviews.Author: WarwickLeamingtonian
Reviews.Content: Booked through Expedia with flights by BA. It all went well until I had my wallet stolen in The Rambles. Please be aware, the pick pockets are about. Anyway, the hotel staff were lovely and nothing was too much trouble. The room, on the front of the building, was a little noisy but you soon got used to it. We had an upgrade to a superior room and it was clean, well equipped and the bed was fantastic...really big and comfortable. If there is a criticism, there should be coffee making facilities in the rooms, it would make the mornings so much more enjoyable! We used a lot of restaurants and coffee houses up and down the street but no one could beat the Murmuri for quality and temperature. I would definitely recommend this hotel, almost faultless!

Reviews.Title: “Murmuri is a perfect hotel in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: TerryG49
Reviews.Content: Murmuri is a delightful boutique hotel, decidedly upscale, and in a great neighborhood. On the Rambla Catalunya, it is only a block from the Gaudi Mila building and about 4 blocks from the Gaudi Battlo. We walked to Sagrada Familia, and all along Las Ramblas into the old section of Barcelona. But, Murmuri is in Eixample, where the streets are wide and buildings just gorgeous. The subway is half a block away, and the No. 24 bus (to Parc Guell) is only a block away, so the location is very convenient. We initially booked a smaller "design" room but upgraded to a superior room with a balcony overlooking La Rambla Catalunya for not a huge amount more. That was a real treat. The room was large enough, though not huge, but nicely appointed and furnished, with a very large extremely comfortable bed (2 twins together) with lots of comfortable pillows. We loved the balcony--great place to have a glass of wine and watch the strollers on La Rambla. The bathroom was huge, and very nice, with large tub with shower in it, towel heater, thick, large plush towels, robe, slippers, nice toiletries, and openable window. The flat screen gave us ready access to English-speaking news channels. We used the room safe which was very easy to operate (with English instructions.) Plenty of closet space. The staff was very courteous and solicitous-extremely helpful. We wanted ice-they brought it. A wine bottle open-they opened it. The glass elevator and sleek modern interior were neat features. The building itself is very attractive. We didn't use the bar or restaurant, as we ate in neighborhood places while out touring. But both looked inviting. The hotel was quiet, had turn-down service, and made one feel pampered and taken care of. I would highly recommend the Murmuri, and would absolutely stay there again if we return to Barcelona. It is a 4-star hotel, but is a very "high" 4-star and probably at least four-and-a-half. The room rates were certainly reasonable for what one got.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, charming hotel”
Reviews.Author: Last1
Reviews.Content: Murmuri was a perfect spot to see the architectural beauty of Barcelona. A small boutique hotel, very stylish, nice room, though quite small as is the case in many European hotels, great bed and pillows. Excellent Thai-Catalan restaurant, I know it sounds weird but it was outstanding. Nice bar, great place to walk, right near the Passage de Gracia.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, staff, and room made a great hotel”
Reviews.Author: SammySafarini
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 3 nights this past weekend at Murmuri hotel, a boutique hotel with lots of character in a very convenient location in Barcelona. It offered me a delicate mix of privacy and personalization. The staff were very helpful and friendly. Very comfortable bed and well-chosen amenities. The restaurant and bar at the ground floor kept busy around the clock. The experience I got at this hotel exceeded my previous four stays at other 4 and 5 star hotels in the city. I cannot think of a single item of improvement besides the fact that there were no laundry bag in the room. I look forward to coming back.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: shop4fun
Reviews.Content: This hotel was in a very central location to many shops and restaurants. If you enjoy walking, you can get to all of the major attractions from here. We did. If you prefer other transportation, the hotel is close to the local subway and the train that will take you to other towns close to Barcelona. I loved the style of the room decor (very contemporary) and the views from our balcony. I'd definitely stay again. One downside was that the hotel did not have a business center, but we were able to use the internet of a sister hotel which was close by.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden gem on the Ramblas Catalunya”
Reviews.Author: deepsapphyr
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Murmuri during the summer of 2010, a beautiful historical building right off the Ramblas Catalunya, it does not get a lot better regarding location. The staff was excellent, made me feel very welcome, I had some goods send to the hotel prior to my arrival and staff looked after it excellent. The standard rooms were a bit too small for my liking and would advise to take a bigger one. They have a very nice bar and breakfast is excellent. You are within walking distance of the Ramblas and Plaza de Catalunya, one of the best chocolatiers of Catalunya is on the next corner and would advise anyone to have a breakfast/lunch there.

Reviews.Title: “Just OK!”
Reviews.Author: katrb
Reviews.Content: We stayed from 7th January for 3 nights - the day we arrived was my birthday (which my husband had mentioned to the hotel on booking). Prior to booking I confirmed with the hotel that they would be able to provide a smoking room - especially with the smoking ban coming in on 1st January and we were told that this would not be a problem. On arrival I asked if it was a smoking room and was told no, that due to the smoking ban there wasn't smoking rooms! Well I would never have booked if that was the case my husband is a very heavy smoker and won't stay where he can't smoke. I explained that I confirmed this at the time and the receptionist said that no requests were guaranteed! Anyway she said she would speak with her manager so we went to the room on 3rd floor and were greeted with the smallest room ever. Nicely decorated but tiny and terrible view - not quite what we expected. We decided to go out but didn't unpack and on return the receptionist said she had spoke to her manager but we would need to pay for an upgrade to a smoking room - another £180 for the 3 nights! I refused and asked to check out where she said she would speak to her manager again. At this point we went back to the room and were coming to the conclusion that we would need to pay this so not to spoil the holiday and my birthday. A chap on the door and she had a new keys and a new room and we were moved to the 5th floor. Room wasn't much bigger and I would have been very disappointed if we would have paid the £180! At least though the holiday wasn't ruined. After that we did enjoy the hotel, bed was comfy and nice big television with english channels, we ordered room service as well which was nice. The hotel was very close to subway station and on a nice street. I do think though that we could have booked something just as good much cheaper as the hotel wasn't anything special.

Reviews.Title: “Great Room Great Location”
Reviews.Author: kiddy888
Reviews.Content: My fiancée and i stayed for two night's 7th / 8th Jan 2011. This hotel is fantastic for a city break all we needed to use it for was a bed of a night and somewhere close by that we could get showered and changed before we head off for a night out. It fitted the bill perfectly and the fact that it is fitted out so nicely , the modern decor works really well and you feel like you are in a much more expensive hotel than 125 euro a night which was the deal we got. The rooms are a little small but they were so well finished and had a really good bathroom with huge shower we didnt need anything more. We have stayed in 5 - 7* hotels all around the world and i couldnt fault the hotel for what we needed. The front desk were helpful and attentive during our stay and also prompt to reply via email when i had asked questions ahead of our arrival. The location i good as well you have a great street to walk down safely into the heart of Barcelona right outside the door or you have a taxi stand 20 meters to the right of the hotel. You are close enough to the husstle and bustle but its quite iof you want a drink in an outside bar without having people walking past all the time. Cabs from the airport cost 27 euros so it was easy to get to and from the airport. We did not eat in the hotel as we found so many great places to eat around town. We will deffinatly go back to barcelona and there is no reason not to stay again at Murmuri.

Reviews.Title: “Really disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Flurry2011
Reviews.Content: Yes a great location, but ... service is really poor- one and a half hours to deliver breakfast; no help with booking museum visit; poor knowledge of access to key monuments; had to pay for wi fi; no business centre to print documents; small rooms which are tired - dirty carpets and scratched fittings; awful lights which do not adjust; no tea or coffee or irons in rooms; reception staff really unfriendly and unhelpful. And i agree smoke smell comes through vents into non smoking rooms. Six nights in 2 "privilege" rooms and I have no idea what the privilege is! Odd "gift" left in room on new year's eve of "love" package including a body crayon and condom. This was an odd gift for a married couple traveling with daughters aged 8 and 13. The hotel looked so lovely on the Internet, I am very disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed Feelings...”
Reviews.Author: Happytravels74
Reviews.Content: We spent five days of our honeymoon staying in one of the apartments (Romea) attached to the hotel and have mixed feelings about Hotel Murmuri. Good - the location is fabulous! There is a metro station just a few steps from the apartment door, lots of restaurants, shops and bars nearby and Murmuri's proximity to the major Gaudi attractions was excellent. The welcoming bottle of Cava and fruit platter for our honeymoon was also a lovely touch. The apartment itself was very well designed and an excellent size. It had a well designed bedroom, including a desk area and quite a lot of cupboard space, reasonable size bathroom with large shower, excellent lounge and kitchen area complete with dining table and a separate laundry with second toilet. It was lovely to come home after a busy day of sightseeing and be able to relax in our lounge room before heading out again. I must note that having access to a clothes washing machine and dryer was fabulous and saved us lots of time and / or money. Booking several months in advance and taking advantage of the long stay offer meant the apartment was extremely good value for money. Not so good - the reception staff were aloof and not very helpful at all. There are no maps or tourist related information in the rooms so it was just as well we were equipped with reliable guide books. The cleaning staff's attention to detail was also a little haphazard. For example, the room set up was different most days and some days they forgot to collect the rubbish and on one day they even left the large garbage bag with our rubbish and the rubbish from their cleaning in the middle of our apartment entrance way. The apartment was also not as described on the internet when we booked. We booked the one bedroom apartment with terrace however on arrival discovered that they do not have a one bedroom apartment with terrace. (It was still however a well appointed and spacious apartment however a terrace would have been a treat and as we booked this we were expecting it). The supplies in the kitchen were very limited so if you were wanting to cook you would be quite restricted with what you could make. Similarly given there was a laundry in the apartment I expected there would be an iron and iron board however not so. After waiting around an hour an iron and ironing board were delivered to our room however I would recommend that they update their iron as this was very old and fairly ineffectual. Also the apartments are located directly opposite a construction site so even with the roller shutters (excellent light block out) the construction noise was very loud. This started from 7.30am with lots of shouting and truck unloading followed by power tools starting at 8am. There was definitely no opportunity for a sleep in. Finally the other negative would be the cost of wifi. To access wifi you had to buy a card which was reasonably expensive, particularly when everywhere else we stayed had free wifi. So for location, the convenience of having more space in an apartment and the excellent price we received I would recommend Hotel Murmuri. I do however feel with just a few improvements the Murmuri could be so much better.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Boutique Hotel - Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: GigsNJ
Reviews.Content: MurMuri is an all-around great hotel for a stay in Barcelona. The rooms are very nice with situational lighting, large bathrooms with robes and plenty of closet/shelf space. The restaurant has an excellent, reasonably-priced price-fix lunch (nice for day of arrival). They kept the kitchen open at 3:55 for us. The bar is a nice setting as well. The front desk was very accomodating with making reservations. Book early for the best deal!

Reviews.Title: “Cigarette Smoke & a Moldy Bathroom”
Reviews.Author: laurendavis
Reviews.Content: I did a lot of research for a hotel in Barcelona. And while there were several others that were less expensive and a bit closer to Plaça de Catalunya, I was smitten by the reviews of Murmuri so I booked it. I was very unhappy with my hotel choice and would not recommend it to others. Here's why: Pros: - Friendly staff - The privilege room is very large, there is a sitting room that we never used (it overlooked a basketball court) Cons: - The hotel has an onsite bar & restaurant directly off the lobby that allows smoking. They leave the doors to these establishments open and every time you walk in the hotel, if the bar & restaurant are open, you are hit in the face by smoke. - While we were on a non smoking floor, there was a ton of smoke coming through our vents. Maybe someone was smoking in their room? Although we complained more than once, nothing was done about it. My husband heard the front desk person say (as we were walking away), if someone wants to smoke in their room, what can I do? Also, they said they were fully booked and could not move us. - There was mold on the bathroom ceiling (quite a bit) - The bathroom ceiling was peeling - Our room overlooked a school's basketball court, which was mainly fine until that one day we tried to take an afternoon nap. - Okay location, but in hindsight, I'd rather be in the Old Town or no more than one block from Plaça de Catalunya - After our stay I sent them several emails about a bill question and also called and left a message for the manager - NONE of these were replied to. I really can't understand the positive hype for this hotel, I can imagine there are far better choices in Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Sophisticated hotel...tasteful decor.”
Reviews.Author: Skier1400
Reviews.Content: This was my first trip to Barcelona, and I was happy with my hotel choice. My room was small, but furnished very nicely with a beautiful bathroom. The only criticism I have is the price of Wifi. I think it was 7.50 euros for an hour or 15 euros for 24 hours. My room was reasonable...141 euros including tax. I would definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice hotel, customer service needs improvement”
Reviews.Author: chachi07
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed at the hotel for five nights. The hotel is in a great location, right on the upper Ramblas, and walking distance to many of the Barcelona sites. A subway station about one block away gives you great transit to other areas of the city. However, for a 4 star hotel, the customer service at the hotel needs improvement. I requested an iron and ironing board upon arrival and was told that they would bring one to the room. They called back a few minutes later indicating that none were available at the time as they only had one in the hotel and all the other ones were broken. It was late and I decided that I would ask again in the morning. The next day they assured me that they would locate one and bring it to the room. Three days later still no iron or board. I called the front desk again and complained and they offered me the laundry service at 9 euros per shirt (the full price). OK, this is a 4 star hotel with 53 rooms and only one functioning iron! An iron finally appeared in the room the last night we were there. If they want to be a four star hotel, they should have iron and boards in every room. Although this is a nice hotel, the whole issue with the iron and the lack of attention to the guests really tainted the overall experience.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: UKTravel37
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in a great location very near to the main shopping streets. We travelled from the airport via the train (for 3 Euros each) and got off at the Passig de Gracia, and then walked the 5 minutes to the hotel. This hotel was one of the better hotels we have stayed in, especially considering it is in the very heart of the city. Rooms were clean, well equipped and looked attractive. Our room had no bath only a shower but the shower was large, gave a great flow and was refreshing. Our sleep was comfortable with no noise at night but our double bed was actually two single beds pushed together, this was the only disappointment during our stay. The hotel restaurant had a nice atmosphere and both the food and the services was very good. We would recommend you eat there at least once. Overall we would definitely stay here again, it is a good centrally located base and an excellent hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The Perfect Barcelona Experience!”
Reviews.Author: jgr0ve
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the M for October and had a great time. Location was perfect-not too touristy, not far out- walking distance from everywhere. Stay in room 601. Quiet, large, great balcony overlooking the Ramblas. Staff was very helpful, providing plug when needed for electronics, reservations, etc. Room service was good. Very clean and modern. They have a great private car service, Mercedes, driver. Great way to explore. Ask for Felix the driver. We will be coming back again. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “a pleasant location”
Reviews.Author: Shi Hu
Reviews.Content: We especially enjoyed the pleasant location of the hotel on Rambla Catalunya. Our room #602 was rather small and unimpressive but it did have a small patio with no view but the weather was great so we did sit outside briefly to relax and catch up on some reading. The beds and pillows were especially comfortable. We generally prefer small boutique hotels but the Murmuri was nothing very special. The staff was sufficient and the restaurant and bar were convenient but neither interesting nor charming. Charging extra for wifi is a big a rip-off! So, all in all, the Murmuri was adequate but I will definitely try another hotel on my next visit to Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: luckylynn
Reviews.Content: Murmuri has a wonderful location near all the best shopping and 'modernisme' buildings, north of the Ramblas, on the Ramblas de Catalunya a much quieter and nicer street to stay on, just off the Passaig de Gracia. The room we had was small, but very well appointed. The bath had a shower, no tub, but was very nice. We booked on Expedia a long time ago and got a great price, so did not mind the small room. The staff were very helpful and the restaurant was terrific. We ate breakfast each day on the corner at (may be spelling it wrong) Maurio's which was great, very local. This was walking distance from most sights and I would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “chic hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: drnassaugal
Reviews.Content: great boutique hotel... modern design in a great location for shoppers and easy access to the metro, underground and main thoroughfare..... Do wish at the rates that WIFI was included. or even if its for a limited time.

Reviews.Title: “A Pokemon Boutique”
Reviews.Author: MaxHants
Reviews.Content: As the saying goes, Either style or comfort, and this one is definitely the former (if black marble and disproportionately large standing lamps, which seem to be the current fad among those designing these "boutique" disasters all over the world, is your kind of style) and NOT the latter. A Kelly Hoppen who designed this hotel, which she claims she is most proud of among her creations (oh please save me from staying in another one of them!) says (BA inflight magazine October 2010) that the two most important things about a hotel are the bed and the concierge service.... Kelly, let me tell you that a double bed in Murmuri's superior room is actually two singles pushed together and held together by nothing but gravity and any sort of cross-bed travel that you may decide to undertake for whatever reason is likely to get your bottom bang onto the cold floor between the two of them. Let me tell you also that there is no concierge in this hotel at all and the reception people are sleepier than Siberian bears in the middle of January. Rooms are tiny. Water from the (swanky, stylish, boutique and generally glamorous) tap trickles into the equally glorious sink with at such vertiginous speed that it takes only about half an hour to wet a toothbrush. The haute couture shower seemingly lacking a thermostatic valve flips between boiling and freezing at its own discretion quickly and without warning. And don't try to change the angle - it gets worse! I have sat on my shares of uncomfortable WC's but theirs beats them all by a mile and a half. Was told by the reception they were moving me to another room, got up early, packed my things in the morning, came down to discover they were not moving me. Asian restaurant is bad for lunch and dinner. No spa, gym or pool. Redeeming features: a lively bar with descent service and music, good jamon serrano for breakfast (although menu is short), clean and relatively quiet. So not all bad but definitely not my choice at the price.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous stay - highly recommend”
Reviews.Author: ems066
Reviews.Content: We also booked well in advance of our trip via the Internet and received a discount. Our room was fantastic (601) and we loved the large, private terrace. The hotel staff is quite welcoming and helpful, providing great dinner reservations and assisting with printing our boarding passes. The location on Rambla Catalunya was perfect for us - near the Gaudi houses and plenty of restaurants and shops - as we do not prefer the touristy hum of areas like La Rambla. Barelona is easily walkable, and the hotel was in a great "strolling" area. The metro system is very easy to use as well, and there is a stop near the hotel. I would also highly recommend taking the time to visit the terrace at the Hotel Majestic to enjoy a drink and the incredible view. Another highlight of our time in Barcelona was attending a guitar performance at the Palau Musica Catalana. There are concerts scheduled most evenings and it is a wonderful opportunity to enjoy great music and beautiful architecture. Believe the hype - this is a great choice when selecting a "home base" for you stay in Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious boutique hotel - Exceeded expectations!”
Reviews.Author: urbantraveller1
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel 4 months in advance and secured a deal for around 110 Euro per night, for a standard room - a very steep discount from the rack rate. The hotel decor was modern and airy for a relatively small building. The lift reminded me of the Apple Store in Tokyo - all glass and again very modern. The rooms were well appointed, they've definitely invested proper infrastructure with dimmer lights at the room entrance and next to both beds with options for 'sleep / tv / ambiance / bright'. There was a large flatscreen TV with ample choices (English and Spanish), 2 fullsize wardrobes, a small desk, oversized arm char (this could be eliminated which would offer more space). Beautiful marble washrooms with a large shower and invisible drain under the 'floating' marble flooring. I'm a fan of clever design and the bathroom was definitely impressive. Cleaning staff were not them most attentive and needed to be reminded to clean the room twice in a 4 night stay. This room is by no means large but it is well planned, comfortable and functional. Front desk staff were fabulous. The murmuri doesn't haev a pool but has use of the Majestic Hotel's pool around the corner, it's on a rooftop and would definitely pass for the backdrop of a fashion photo shoot, ample loungers and great cocktails poolside. Also check out the tapas restaurant Catalana which is just next to the MAC store down the street, it's fantastic and very reasonable. The hotel is in a great location for shopping, sightseeing and a short taxi down to the beach.

Reviews.Title: “Swank Stay”
Reviews.Author: JasonWG
Reviews.Content: Trendy and modern hotel in a good location. We like staying up the Passieg de Gracia. Won't be preferred by most - it is a long walk to the Born district or Bari Gottic. But there is a great feel up here and this hotel is a funky little place to stay. It is not cheap for what you get, but the rooms are more than comfortable and a wonderful place to come back after a long day of touring. Lots of great cervecerias nearby (Tapac 24 and Cerveceria Catalonia are fabulous, Divinius is good as well). Thing with Barcelona is there are so many hotels it is more about getting a deal in the category of choice. Murmuri is a good bet if you get a competitive rate - but there are a lot of hotels that can match it. We've stayed in Barcelona 8 times and have only returned to the Arts hotel more than once. The rest we keep touring about to find new places.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location -”
Reviews.Author: ChateauLM
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel cannot be beat - convenient to all the sites and hot spots in Barcelona. Minutes to the Metro, great tapas bars and walking distance to many great tourist areas. The hotel is typically trendy boutique. The bar is lovely - drinks are pricey but good. The room was beautifully designed though very compact. Very limited space for luggage. The bathroom had great shower facilities though I was surprised at the mold on the ceiling. Great bed and quiet for sleeping. Only negative was the check in / check out service. The gentleman was not particularly pleasant and had no knowledge of the Visa Infinite Program or Preferred Hotels Membership benefits (despite the brochures in their lobby!). We did not get the upgraded room we were expecting at check-in nor the free WIFI. When I raised the gap in expectations they were not accomodating or interested in resolving. Given there are many amazing hotels in Barcelona I wouldn't rush back to this one in light of the service received. We also stayed at the ABaC while in Barcelona and there is simply no comparison when it comes to service - ABaC gets it and is a true 5 star.

Reviews.Title: “Location and style; good place to stay”
Reviews.Author: jeanniedc
Reviews.Content: We booked two rooms at the Murmuri before a cruise this July. There were several very good features of this hotel: 1) LOCATION - we loved this about it. Was only a block from a metro which we used a lot. Is in a very safe part of town on a pretty and fairly quiet street. 2) We had two separate rooms, but there was a door outside both that could be locked while our rooms were open. This was a nice feature when traveling with kids. 3) Rooms were nice with good lighting; slightly small, but ours had a little sitting area in the back which made it feel more spacious. 4) We booked a package that came with breakfast - very nice. 5) staff was very pleasant and helpful. 6) Hotel restaurant was excellent and not too crazy expensive. My only negative comment would be about the bathrooms. They were very large, but the use of space was not good. There were literally no hooks in our bathrooms, and the shower was huge but the fixtures were not well placed. Other than that, this is a great place to stay in Barcelona!!!

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel experience in the centre of Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: Ozdu
Reviews.Content: The Murmuri is very central to main attractions. It is a modern design hotel but with a warm, soothing feel to it very friendly & helpful staff great bar serving an excellent espresso martini and great fingerfood. Rooms are good and well appointed with modern design (but not the modern design that can make hotels dysfunctional). Breakfast is not included but the €16 is well spent is you are a breakfast person, otherwise grab one the english breakfasts for €4 at one of the cafés on paseo de gracia (where the hotel is located) - PS: the espresso's are good and included in the €16. Staff was very accommodating and provided solid restaurant recommendations, booked the restaurants and even called us on our int mobile phone to let us know which restaurants they're able to book for us! We spent out first night in room 604 - a great terrace but the room itself is just too small. So avoid the rooms with a large terrace as it goes at the expense of the room size. Next day they moved us to room 405 - same category buy more spacious and more closets as well. Balcony is smaller than 604 but it's there and big enough to lounge if you want to (and we did one morning).

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommended”
Reviews.Author: brodmktg
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a three night stay and greatly enjoyed Murmuri. (It had been recommended by a Barcelona-based relative of my wife's business associate.) For my wife and me, we booked online the spa package which included daily breakfast and a massage and hydrotherapy and the grander Hotel Majestic, a five-minute walk. For our teenagers, we booked room-only as they preferred to go out for breakfast at a nearby bakery. I concur with all the positive comments I had read before booking: outstanding location in the city, stylish/comfortable rooms, and so on. My one major quibble was that the front desk staff did not seem to have a handle on suggestions for restaurants for dinner. They were happy to book a table...but couldn't come up with great suggestions. Also, would've expected free WiFi. Bonus points: they were happy to keep several of our suitcases in storage for three days at no charge, while we travelled to Mallorca, before returning to Murmuri for our final night.

Reviews.Title: “Just Perfect”
Reviews.Author: rakibey
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Murmuri in July over a weekend. There was nothing negative to say, only positive. Rooms are very nice and fresh. New feeling to it. Cool design of both the hotel in general and rooms, glass elevator etc. The staff was very friendly and spoke an excellent english, which is not seen so many places in Spain.. The area of the hotel is very nice, just next to the exclusive shopping street in Barcolona. A very good and safe area, in walking distance to La Rambla if anyone would wanna go there:-) In our opinion though, La Rambla is just a totally touristic place, the area of the hotel is exclusive and more calm. The hotel did not have a swimming pool, but had a 5 star sister hotel that we could go to and have a swim in their very small swimmingpool at the roof top. Very nice view from there though, so go and have a drink at this location. Go ahead and book this hotel without doubt.

Reviews.Title: “PERFECT BOUTIQUE HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: kostas72
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the murmuri for five nights in mid August. We had a great experience. The location is beautiful, the room was pretty and clean, service was excellent. Breakfast was very tasteful. The hotels restaurant had great delicius dishes (keep in mind that it is rather expensive) . In a few words "the right hotel to stay in barcelona". HOLA! Kostas and Eva Tzellos.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, Excelent location, Great value”
Reviews.Author: zipili
Reviews.Content: We really enjoy our stay at the Murmuri. Le location is really great, the design cosy, elegant and this is really a 4 Star hotel. Personnel is nice . I recommend really that hotel for a short stay in Barcelona

Reviews.Title: “Boutique Hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: sd28
Reviews.Content: Hotel Murmuri has what you would expect in a boutique style hotel. Clean, spacious with efficient staff. Our room had a terrace that was beautiful. The hotel is conveniently situated close to all the major shopping areas and a nice walk to lots of major attractions and great restaurants. It was also about a 20 minute walk to Sagrada Familia. The continental breakfast was perfect to start off the day. Staff is a little slow in the morning. Overall the hotel was everything we had expected and the weather was perfect in June!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, superb location & connecting rooms!!”
Reviews.Author: ajmita
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Murmuri in Barcelona was the perfect place for our family of four to stay during our recent visit to Barcelona. Our children are ages 10 & 14 and need a separate room but I prefer it to connect to our room. I cannot tell you how few hotels offer connecting rooms! The Hotel Murmuri does offer connecting rooms that are at the end of a hallway, so you shut one main outside door and then can keep both room doors open. Very convenient for families with older children! We reached the Murmuri at around noon time but having been on a short cross Atlantic redeye flight, we were in desperate need of sleep. It was wonderful that our rooms were ready and that we could sink into the comfort of bed as soon as we arrived. Both our rooms were very comfortable. Our room had a large separate seating area while the children's room had a balcony. The children's room had a large wardrobe near the entrance, while our room had slightly less storage space. The desk in our room was directly at the foot of the bed making the room feel a bit smaller than it actually was. The front desk staff was extremely friendly and helpful. They were happy to help with reservations, tours, etc. As most reviewers have repeated, the location is superb, on a wonderful street and close to many of the landmarks of the city.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Wendy021065
Reviews.Content: Thoroughly enjoyed my stay at this hotel. Hotel was modern and clean and staff were very helpful. Use of the sister hotel (Majestic) was a wonderful experience. Hotel Restaurant was beautiful..

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for a Barcelona Break”
Reviews.Author: acdublin1980
Reviews.Content: Murmuri is simply a great boutique hotel (usually the adjective 'boutique' makes me run a mile!) We stayed for three nights in a superior room which was a good size for a city hotel (but not big by any means). The king bed was FANTASTIC, the bathroom ultra modern and well kitted out. Everything in the hotel is chic and trendy but never poncey or uppity. Prices were very reasonable when booked a few weeks in advance and I couldn't recommend it more highly. The location is great if you want to be right on Rambla de Catalunya in the heart of Barcelona. The Metro station is literally 75 yards from the door, too. We did spend most of our time in the old town and we probably could have done with being a little closer to that than having to use the Metro to get there. Not a big deal though and Murmuri is at the centre of a lot of action. We were on the street side of the hotel and never heard any noise at night whatsoever. One last thing: As I always gripe about places who charge for Internet then it would be unfair not to gripe at Murmuri! Come on, it's 2010 - you can't justify charging over €17 a day (after tax) for providing Wifi! A minor issue in an otherwise wonderful boutique hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location!!!”
Reviews.Author: Accounting Professor
Reviews.Content: One can't beat the location. My husband was attending a meeting at the Palais de Congress just below Montjuc. He had a 15 - 20 minute trip via Metro. The Metro station (Diagonal) is one half block from the hotel. The Rambla Catalyuna has a wide pedestrian median with narrow one-way streets on either side. In the median are many outdoor cafes, bistros, etc. One block over is Barcelona's equivalent of Michigan Avenue in Chicago.; the Ple de Gracia is lined with top designer stores. On the side treets are the top restaurants in Barcelona. On every block there is a bank, a pharmacia, a parfumeria, a bakery, a lingerie shop, a shoe stores etc. The "all important" Starbuck is an immediate left down a side alley. 45 minutes of internet access per purchase. For Americans, it is one of the few places with "Amercian or British or French style morning coffee. The Catalans drink espresso either straight or with "latte", i.e. milk. I love espresso in the evening, but I need my large drip or french press coffee in the morning. Did I mention that the Familia Sagrad is a mere 2 metro stops away? We stayed in 301, which fronted the street and had a king size bed. There was no street noise at night. It is a lovely street, but it is not a "main drag". I noted in an earlier review the mention of lack of drawer space. Not so! The two small wardrobes had ovehead shelves and two bottom shelves. The night stands each had 2 drawers and the TV stand had drawers. It is hanging space that is in short supply. Only one wardrobe had hangers. Those with many suits, dresses, etc. will have limited space. The bathroom has a large amount of storage space due to a shelf under the sink and counter. My only complaints were first the lack of an iron in the room. Yes, housekeepig delivered a board and iron upo request, but the iron was a puny appliance incapable of reaching a hot temperature. My second issue was the TV. It is a lovely,flat creen TV. Sadly, the hotel advertises that international channels are provided. International must mean Catalon and Spanish. There was not one English speaking channel. French and German did not exist either. Given the nationalities of the cliental, this must be remedied. We have relocated to a Hilton managed property which has over a dozen English channels includinging CNN, FOX, FOX News, CNBC, BBC, Europsorts and several French and German channels. Murmuri can do better. I don't understand the "pricey" comments. What do people expect to pay for a designer boutique hotel in a prime location in a major European or USA city. If yo expect ot pay much less than $200 a night, you are living in a fantasy world. We spent 5 nights and prepaid around $1000. This is money well spent!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel. Great location. Amazing staff.”
Reviews.Author: TomTomB
Reviews.Content: While location and hotel were great, it was the quality of the staff that left the biggest impression. Most helpful staff I've experienced. Excellent choice of hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Small and Perfect”
Reviews.Author: kemmy
Reviews.Content: The hotel was fabulous. The service was great, the staff was helpful, the location was absolutely perfect. The room was on the smaller side and if you do not pack light, you may not have enough drawer space for your things. The room was clean, they left yummy chocolate on your pillows, and the decor was modern yet classic. The bed was absolutely comfortable and the hotel was a nice respite. They do have an odd breakfast offer that is unnecessarily expensive given the eateries surrounding the hotel such as the Fornet, Mauri, and the coffee bar around the corner. They did not have free internet and it was absurdly expensive given that you can get internet at starbucks for the price of a cup of tea. I did not like their recommendations for restaurants, they were often overpriced and geared towards tourists. I would stick to recommendations by locals and some of the restauranteurs who are very helpful in making suggestions.

Reviews.Title: “Both chic and friendly, Hotel Murmuri is a boutique hotel in a great part of Barcelona.”
Reviews.Author: BocaTraveler09
Reviews.Content: Hotel Murmuri is a small hotel with style and flair, located in the L'Eixample area. The rooms are contemporary with surprisingly large bathrooms and luxury amenities. We chose a "superior" room and, with an advance booking rate, found it worth the money. Although the room wasn't large, it was efficiently-designed and had lots of storage. The staff was friendly, attentive and helpful. I spent a lot of time reviewing the various areas of Barcelona and am very happy that we chose L'Eixample. It is upscale, with wonderful shops and eateries and wide boulevards. It is close to many wonderful Gaudi buildings and a long walk or inexpensive cab ride to all the other attractions. We were happy not to be in the more crowded, touristy parts of the city. We enjoyed time in the bar and dining in the Asian-Spanish restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Modern but small”
Reviews.Author: Raineaway
Reviews.Content: This is a classy, modern and clean hotel. The rooms do look as nice as they do in the website's photos. However, the rooms are very small. We travelled with an infant and the stroller barely fit in the hallway. They also allow smoking in the bar by the lobby so the smell seem to permeate the hotell. I suppose it's not just a Hotel Murmuri issue. Cigarette smoke seems to be tolerated everywhere in Spain.

Reviews.Title: “Would return in a heartbeat!”
Reviews.Author: stacy1259
Reviews.Content: We stayed on the Hotel Murmuri for 8 nights in May and loved the hotel! The location is perfect. Its located 10-12 blocks from the tourist chaos of La Rambla. Great shops and cafes everywhere around the hotel. The Metro is a block away which was perfect! We stayed in the Design Room, with no complaints. The room is well decorated, nice TV, great bathroom, very quiet, and gets nice and dark with the shades drawn. We slept great every night. For breakfast, the cost at the hotels is not worth it. There are a ton of amazing places right around the hotel where two people can eat for 5-10 Euros. The hotel charges 16 Euros each day or 10 Euros if you agree to do breakfast there everyday when you check in. The hotel bar is very convenient...yes their listed cocktails are overpriced, but they do have affordable options. We spent a lot of time at their sidewalk bar. We had dinner there one night and we loved it, it exceeded my expectations. It was great food and sometimes a break from Tapas is warranted. I wish the hotel would include internet or at least make it more affordable. We paid 7-8 Euros for 45 mins and there wasn't a printer which made checking in for flights annoying since you were dependent on the front desk. Also, if you want to use the gym while you are there. The hotel does not have one, but you have access to the Majestic Hotel's which is a 5 min walk. I am crazy with research, so trust the reviews on this one...its a great hotel choice in Barcelona. Walkable to several sights, away from the tourist traps and so easy to get around from.

Reviews.Title: “Felt like home!”
Reviews.Author: Gloryb32
Reviews.Content: We were very pleased with this hotel. We arrived prior to 9:00am after an overnight flight from Philadelphia thinking we would just drop our bags at the hotel. We were pleasantly suprised to find that we could get into a room. We were treated like family and made to feel very welcome. The room, although a little small, suited our needs. The bathroom was large and decor was modern. The staff was always pleasant and helpful. They answered all of our questions regarding restaurants, directions and metro travel. I travel often for business and stay in various hotels depanding on location. I would definitely go back to Hotel Murmuri for business or pleasure. You can't go wrong with this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Service!”
Reviews.Author: stepdon
Reviews.Content: Everyone at the front desk is a concierge, cheerful and always available for your every need and at any time. they were most helpful for anything we asked for, including info on the metro, restaurants ,directions, and anything else when you need some hand-holding in a strange city.Edourd, the manager, and Damian practically became our new best friends! The European-style breakfast was very serviceable, and a good value at the promotional rate of 10 euros, and we like the convenience of breakfast at our hotel, so we can freshen up in our room afterwards. Our bathroom was spacious and had all the modern amenities. If anything, we would say the room was a tad small, and we would get larger room the next time. The location is ideal, being in L"Exaimple, near many Gaudi buildings, chic Paseo de Gracia, and being on Rambla de Catalyuna which has a lovely island for walking, great restaurants, and within easy walking distance of the busier areas of the Ramlas. We will definitely return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “would not stay again”
Reviews.Author: robinchristenson
Reviews.Content: Our room was amazing BUT it was absolutely filthy when we got there--also they were very late getting our room ready--ALMOST 5pm and it was still dirty--bedspread was wrinkled and stunk like old smoke--shower smelled of mildew--ended up at the Omm after 3 nights there- Only saving grace is beautiful design

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding! Awesome! Simply Perfect! Amazing!”
Reviews.Author: Vavinana
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this incredible Hotel and it was fantastic. We had a really great time, the small boutique Hotel has everything you are looking for. The room was spotless, the matresses are so comfortable and the food in the restaurant is just delicious. The staff, specially Robertus in front desk is so helpful. I was robbed in The Rambla de Catalunya and he run after the thieves and catch him and he saved my life! It was just a dream! We had the chance to have a few conversations with the General Manager and he is very profesional and smart. He is doing a great job. Thank you for this lovely experience, Miss Singa

Reviews.Title: “Nice Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: GavT
Reviews.Content: This hotel was recommended to me by a guy I met on a plane going to Vegas, he seemed well travelled and well versed in quality hotels so i thought why not trust a complete stranger. Well, he was right it is a lovely hotel, well decorated and in a good location. On arrival we were advised that our "special request" of a double bed could not be granted which to me was shocking. If they hadnt had a double at the time of booking then I would have gone to the 'W' or 'Hotel Arts'. They didnt back down and the attitude on this subject was bad, still its not like we were spending a few hundred Euro's or anything. The staff are all very pretty, but at the same time helpfull and courteous. Food and Drink prices border on the ridiculous, 5 euros for a small draft beer and between 11 & 15 euros for a cocktail. But theer are plenty of other places in Barcelona to eat. Room wasnt ready on arrival but was a nice room and well decorated. Bed was comfortable (even if they were twins pushed together). All in all more than happy to recommend the hotel just be prepared to not get your choice of bed.

Reviews.Title: “Unbelievable! (and not in a good way)”
Reviews.Author: manglwurzl
Reviews.Content: I had the same experience as newyorkold ("Livid" 5/23/09) almost a year later. My colleague and I arrived at the Murmuri ~ 10:30PM exhausted from a long work day and flights from Amsterdam. On arrival, we were greeted and asked inside, then we were told that unfortunately there were no rooms available (although we had both booked through American Express - our corporate travel booking agent). We were then asked to wait for a cab that would then take us their "5-star sister property." Remarkably, I recalled reading the review, and objected, but was told there was no option. On arrival at the sister property, we were greeted in a rather ambivalent manner and given our rooms. I suggested that for the inconvenience, perhaps the hotel would like to buy us a drink. I was told no, but given the option of an upgraded room. I agreed. When show to the room, I looked around and saw no windows; sure the room was big, but there were no windows, only 2 small skylights. 5-star in this case was well beyond questionable. When I objected, I was taken to a much smaller room with a window (and a view of scaffolding) that smelled oddly of bacalao, body odor, and egg. Pissed-off, but with no obvious alternative, my colleague and I went to dinner. Over dinner, we relaxed a bit and decided to switch hotels. We moved after dinner at ~ 1AM. Best decision ever. There is no possible way I can recommend this hotel. However, he following afternoon, we did stop in to the sister hotel to speak with the manager and verify there would be no charges. She was very gracious, and a radical departure from her nighttime staff. She presented her card, and requested that next time I plan a stay in Barcelona, I call ahead and she'd guarantee a room in the Murmuri. I'm willing to give it a second chance, but will defintely not waiver from this review until that time.

Reviews.Title: “Absolute gem, one of the best hotels we've stayed in”
Reviews.Author: Sam715
Reviews.Content: Brilliant hotel, lovely large rooms, trendy 'cosmopolitan' decoration, absolutely massive walk in shower, molton brown toiletries and excellent location - in the exclusive shopping district. Would def stay here again, exceeded all our expectations.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous gem of a hotel”
Reviews.Author: KatieBS
Reviews.Content: A surprise 3 day trip to Barcelona to celebrate my husband's impending 40th birthday took us to the Hotel Murmuri in mid April. We stayed in Room 602 which I believe is shown on the hotel's website photos showing a Privilege Room. Small(ish) but has all the amenities and comforts we could have asked for. The kingsize bed was so comfortable and there was no noise at all from the busy street outside. The curtains are blackout curtains allowing for a quiet and restful night's sleep. French doors opened up to a very sizeable terrace with 2 sun loungers and a table/chairs for 2 - a joy in a busy big city like Barcelona. The bathroom had everything we needed and a great bathtub - be advised there is a window overlooked by neighbouring rooftops but we came to the conclusion that noone could actually see in and threw caution to the wind as we stood and showered by the window! I took baths which were blissful but my husband's mild complaint was that the 'raindrop shower' didn't give much pressure. The hotel is perfectly located. It's a short stroll to Gaudi's Casa Mila & Casa Botllo (on the parallel street Passeig de Gracia - where all the high-end luxury brands have their stores). At the bottom of Passeig de Gracia (or the hotel's street/Rambla de la Catalunya) is Placa de Catalunya, the other side of which is La Rambla. Don't confuse the hotel's elegant street with La Rambla - a bit rough round the edges these days and full of tacky tourist attractions although still worth a visit. Diagonal metro station is about a 2 minute walk from the hotel and from there you can go north to Gaudi's fabulous Parc Guell, or head in the other direction (just 2 stops) to the incredible Sagrada Familia or go 2 stops to Passeig de Gracia where you can switch lines to head to the Barrio Gotico, Barceloneta or a host of other hot spots. I really can't think of a better location in Barcelona from which to go sightseeing. We returned from a rather enthusiastic sangria drinking evening by the Cathedral and popped in the bar at the hotel for a nightcap. This was a bit disappointing - a very narrow bar with beautiful decor but funnily enough very little ambience. The drinks were way overpriced as they often are in hotels. I would suggest bypassing the hotel bar and instead finding alternatives. If you have a room with a balcony as we did, and fancy an early evening aperatif, there is a small supermarket about a block away which sells very cheap beer & wine (3 EUR for 6 San Miguel beers). It was a nice end to our jam packed days, to return to the hotel, wrap ourselves in the luxurious robes and 'slice of heaven' hotel slippers, have a shower/bath and then head to the terrace with an ice cold beer and a book to unwind before heading out for the evening. There aren't a lot of amenities at the hotel (no fitness room, etc although they do have a partnership with the larger Majestic Hotel about a 5 mins walk away for spa treatments) but if you're looking for a huge chunk of comfort, close proximity to all the main sights of Barcelona, wonderfully friendly staff and a lovely room, this is the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: O2BCyrus
Reviews.Content: We just returned from Barcelona where we spent three nights at Hotel Murmuri. The hotel was very clean (and we're picky about that point), and the staff was extremely helpful to us -- we simply could not have asked for more accommodating hosts! Other reviewers have done a good job of describing this modern hotel's features, but I wanted to answer for others a few of the questions I found unanswered before my travels. 1) This is a very nice neighborhood. No worries there -- it's probably the nicest (and safest) part of Barcelona. If you're looking at the tourist guidebooks, the neighborhood is called Eixample. 2) In addition to the Bar Marfil and Restaurant Murmuri on the hotel premises, there are plenty of cafes and restaurants nearby. Be aware that many of them will be closed on Sundays, but some will remain open (your number of choices will be diminished, but you won't go hungry!) 3) There are a pleasant number of people on the streets in the evening. Rambla de Catalunya is NOT Las Ramblas (which is the loud and noisy and screaming area with a lot of bars and horns honking and whatnot). There is plenty to see and plenty of people to watch, but not the level of noise and revelry that will keep you up late at night. You can walk or Metro to Las Ramblas if you want the activity, but then escape to more civilized surroundings when you return to your hotel to rest. 4) There is LOTS of high-end shopping in this area. Not my thing, but if you want to gawk at Gucci and other high-end design stores, this is the place to be. 5) You're one block from Le Pedrera (Casa Mila), and the local tourist bus stop; 2-3 blocks from the "Block of Discord," where Casa Batllo is one of three stunning Modernista buildings; 1/2 block from Diagonel Metro stop, and right around the corner from a fabulous coffee and pastry shop (Cafe Mauri). 6) The staff at Murmuri are incredible and very helpful. They do speak English very well, which was helpful to us as our Spanish is poor (at best!). 7) The rooms do not have universal electrical adapters, but Murmuri has them -- just contact the front desk. 8) The hotel doesn't exchange currency, but there is a bank across the street that does, as does the more staid Hotel Majestic, which is located about 2 blocks away (Murmuri and Majestic are both owned/operated by Majestic Hotel Group). We thought exchange rates were decent at both places. 9) The rooms are spacious by European standards (less generous space than American travelers are used to, but our room at Murmuri was certainly more spacious than at the also-fine Majestic (see separate review for our first night stay at Majestic). Here are a couple of hints: HINT #1: Keep the hotel address at hand. This is not a giant hotel that every driver knows (in Barcelona, there aren't a lot of 1,000 room Hiltons -- it's full of the smaller, boutique hotels like Murmuri), so it's important to have the address in hand. It's also important to know the cross streets to look for so that you can find it (Carrer de Provenca on one side and Passtage de la Concepcio on the other); I recommend printing out the map on the hotel's website just to be sure you won't miss it the first time you look for it. HINT #2: Know that you will need to look directly AT the building to see the sign for Murmuri -- it is tucked inside the alcove to the doorway, rather than standing out at right angles so oncoming traffic can see it. Murmuri is an old building that has had a wonderful makeover on the inside, but the outside edifice still the traditional stone facade. (I'm probably not explaining this very well: what I'm trying to say is it's a great hotel, but the signage isn't great and you need to look AT it or you'll miss it.
