See their website at murmuri.com to take a look at their photo of the sign and you'll see what I mean -- I mention this because we almost passed the hotel without noticing it.).

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, gorgeous room and great location”
Reviews.Author: EnglandBeach_lover
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for our 10th wedding anniversary and got a great deal on a privilege room. The room was stunning, really quiet so we slept well and perfectly located for the Metro. We even managed to watch to the beach the first afternoon! Would recommend this hotel to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “just perfect”
Reviews.Author: ARobinson_10
Reviews.Content: We had the most perfect stay at the Murmuri, location is great, right near the nicest shops and the best restaurants....rooms are a bit on the small but really gorgeous nevertheless. The bar is very sexy and the restaurant serves very interesting asian tapas, try the fishcakes. However the best thing about this hotel that makes it stand out from so many others is tha fabulous service , everyone is so genuinely brillliant at their job, thay make you feel at so at home and welcome in this wonderful city and don't have any of that awful attitude that most fashionable boutique hotels have. best boutique hotel I have ever stayed in because of the service.....by far

Reviews.Title: “Great location, lovely rooms, fab bar, but breakfast can be shambolic”
Reviews.Author: cheryltheperil
Reviews.Content: Really well appointed room including ipod dock and moody lighting. Lovely bathroom with a proper, walk in monsoon shower and a seemingly endless supply of towels. The bar is very cosy and definitely a nice place to come for a post-dinner drink. The location is perfect with many shops and cafes close by, which brings me on to the only downside - breakfast at the hotel takes a good hour, no mean feat when you consider nobody is actually cooking anything. That isn't to say that breakfast isn't good - it is. Just very slow on some mornings. It wouldn't stop me coming back here but it would make me consider whether to include breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Murmuri - will stay there again”
Reviews.Author: jviel
Reviews.Content: The hotel is well located along the ipper end of La Rambla. You can walk to many shops and restaurants, and the metro is just steps away. The architecture is very modern, and the rooms seem recently updated. All the fixtures and features are very modern and convenient. There is plenty of storage and closet space, and the beds are reasonably comfortable. Our room was in the back and had a nice balcony. There was no view, but frankly we did not plan to stay in the room much. We never tried the restaurant or lounge so we cannot comment on it.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding!”
Reviews.Author: LondonShopgirl
Reviews.Content: Having never been to Barcelona, I spent some time researching hotels and took a fancy to the glossy website of the Murmuri. It was a good price for a 4 night trip for my mother and I, and I booked with my fingers crossed. The hotel was superb, the staff were very friendly and helpful, the room was beautiful and spacious, with a huge walk in shower and luxury toiletries...much higher standard than I was expecting for a standard double room. The hotel is flawless in design, and the standard of cleanliness and service is never compramised. Each day we returned from our sightseeing/shopping, the bed was turned down, the side lamps switched on and chocolates on the bed,- a welcome touch!The bar and dining area is also exceptional, with great views of the busy streets for you to sit and 'people watch' over a coffee. Surrounded by beautiful architecture and shops, its a perfect location all round

Reviews.Title: “Very convenient location and excellent service in comfortable hotel”
Reviews.Author: TCSCambridge_UK
Reviews.Content: Excellent break at this hotel very conveniently located for shopping and sightseeing in centre of Barcelona. Room was very quiet, comfortable bed and all facilities worked very well. Hotel staff at front desk extremely helpful in arranging a day trip out of town and provided faultless service at breakfast and when eating in hotel. Food very good in hotel's own asian-accented restaurant one evening. Only very small quibble was that room only had a shower not a bath - but our fault for not checking this out when booking - but it was a superb shower!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful, Excellent, Terrific. Thank you Eduardo”
Reviews.Author: NyackWeekender
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Hotel MurMuri for 3 nights last week. My family members travelling with me had one room, and I had another. and can honestly say it was one of the best hotel experiences I have ever had. *The room was spectacular *The Front Desk staff was exemplary; (Thank you Anna et al.) *The food and beverage operations were outstanding. *The comfort was over the top *The room rate was attractive *Breakfast was delicious *Dinner in the restaurant was perfect *Drinks in the lounge were appropriately alcoholic and served in a cozy atmosphere * Eduardo, the General Manager, was a great representative for the hotel, seemed to be everywhere 24/7, and made sure our stay met our expectations in every way. I couldn't ask for anything more. Thank you Murmuri. I wouldnt stay anywhere else in Barcelona

Reviews.Title: “Not good for people who don't like smoke.”
Reviews.Author: 143JTKC
Reviews.Content: Good things about Murmuri: 1) Excellent location (i.e., just steps form Gaudi's works; Metro is right on the corner; the famous Mauri cafe is also right around the corner). 2) If you like a modern, boutique hotel, Hotel Murmuri is just that. Bad things about Murmuri (as you can see, the bad outweighs the good): 1) We asked for a "privilege" room, but were put in a room of lesser quality and were charged for it; we asked to be moved the second night. Tip: Make sure that you get the room that you paid for! 2) The concierge staff does not speak English very well. They are also not very helpful with directions and don't seem to know the area very well. Some of them seem a little ditzy. 3) The bathtubs are very slippery and narrow. You could easily crack your skull in there so be careful! 4) The rooms are EXTREMELY smokey. If you don't like smoke, this is not the place for you. We were on the sixth floor, but we could still smell the intense cigar smoke from the cigar bar rise up to our level. We had to open up our window to get any semblance of fresh air in. 5) The pillows feel like rocks. 6) The breakfast is not included, very expensive, and doesn't have much variety. Hope this review helps!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel overall - just needs to look at breakfast arrangements”
Reviews.Author: highfly
Reviews.Content: The Murmuri location is great. The area is nice and there are plenty of places to eat and drink around it. Very convenient for Gaudi houses and only 15 mins pleasant walk to Place Catalunya (and bus to/from airport if you want) The hotel is very stylish and all fittings seem to be high end quality makes – bath, washbasin, shower, TV etc. We had booked a double superior and were initially allocated 202 which was a smoking room. After a bit of a wait we got room 302 which was non smoking. Our info in advance had said that designated smoking rooms were available on request whilst in practice it seems there is a need to specify non smoking. The room was very nice – a huge bed, good lighting with choice of settings – relax, ambient etc, good bedside reading lights and room light controls at bedside. Small balcony which was a pleasant bonus –not really for sitting out but nice to get fresh air. Three narrow wardrobes at different points of the room gave adequate storage, although a bit tight on space to access the room safe in wardrobe beside chair and near window. Access to mini bar almost impossible as opened against the room where chair blocked robe door. Bathroom beautiful and all aspects worked well. All areas very clean and housekeeping did a good job – as if by magic (never saw them once anywhere in the hotel) TV had about 500 channels but we couldn’t find one in English. A call to reception on day 2 solved this and girl pressed analogue button I think which gave access to English channels, so don’t assume they aren’t there. Breakfast was the main let down. The food was fine, but somewhat limited. Choice of 3 juices, cereals, croissants, pain au chocolat, some bread, nice preserves, smoked salmon or ham salad sandwiches, cheeses, ham. The highlight for me was the scrummy fruit kebabs. Have to say staff were not quick to replenish items. Also, breakfast was supposed to be until 11am but the food was whisked off about 10.50. Hot food was available to order but was all at an additional charge. One euro for bacon, 2 euros eggs, 3 euros for omelette. What a cheap move. I know times are hard but when you are paying these prices that is cheap and shoddy. However, the system/service was woeful. No one to greet you so you just sat down. You would wait ages until anyone came near – and they were only interested in asking your room number(which they usually forgot and had to ask again.) No interest whatsoever in offering tea or coffee (getting blood from a stone comes to mind) Tea was half a cup of luke warm water from a flask with a teabag to follow unless you asked for a pot. Never in 3 days were we asked would we like tea or coffee or would we like more tea or coffee. Easiest just to get up and go to the workstation and get it yourself but usually they had run out. There was a bottle of cava in an ice bucket on the way in at the opposite end of the dining room from the rest of the breakfast but it was certainly never offered by the staff. Maybe you had to ask for it…on the basis of charging for bacon maybe you had to pay. I’ll never know!! The bar was pleasant for a drink and was usually quite busy – seemed to be a place to be seen. However, as with everywhere in Barcelona smoking is prevalent ( if you are used to UK and Ireland no smoking in public places laws and don’t smoke it can be very off putting but that’s just something you have to get used to. Great for smokers though!) Overall a good stay but let down by breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great staff, great location”
Reviews.Author: kft11
Reviews.Content: Some friends and I stayed for nearly a week. The regular rooms were clean and well appointed. Furnishings were new. Bathrooms were new and pristine. The hotel staff was superb and provided excellent guidance about where to dine and what to do. The city has become one of my favorites and so has this hotel -- it has a boutique feel with great quality. Reminds me in that respect of the Sagamore in South Beach.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel, excellent location”
Reviews.Author: IrelanfNicole13
Reviews.Content: This hotel is fantastic, the rooms are big and spacious and very modern. The bathroom is the exact same. The staff are very friendly and very helpful. It has an excellent location which means that you can walk anywhere, there is also a metro station close by for longer trips. The hotel has a bar which is nice but quite expensive for drinks. Along the strip outside the hotel there are numerous restraunts and tapas bars.

Reviews.Title: “More than a place to sleep”
Reviews.Author: lyrums
Reviews.Content: What a great hotel - great rooms, great service, excellent staff, fantastic restaurant, top location. If you're looking for somewhere to stay in Barcelona then the boutique Murmuri is it. It is close to many of the Gaudi houses but far enough away from the mayhem of La Rambla. The Metro is almost at the doorstep, too. We stayed in a Privilege room, which has a great extra room where we put a three-year-old in a fold-away bed and a one-year-old in a cot. The room has a sliding door that can be closed to allow parents privavcy and rest! Our only complaint - the restaurant doesn't have a high chair for babies.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel”
Reviews.Author: Torpegart
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Murmuri for 3 nights, and everything was perfect. Great location, beautiful rooms and very friendly staff, who knows the city. The Bar Marfill on the hotel is a very cosy place to enjoy a drink or some snacks, but the restaurant was a little bit of a letdown, compared to everything else in the hotel. Would recommend it to anyone, if they aren't on a budget. Will stay there for sure next time I'm in Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “A lovely little hotel”
Reviews.Author: LondonsSweetTooth
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Murmuri for three nights in November 2009 for a short city break. The hotel was well located within walking distance to many sights and close to bars and restaurants. The room (£92 per night, booked through Expedia special rate) was a good size with a nice bathroom, but no shower. The only drawback was the lack of tea/coffee making facilities in the room. Hotel staff were helpful during our stay, answering any questions we may have had and generally being polite and efficient. I would stay here again without hesitation. LST

Reviews.Title: “Quiet Elegance”
Reviews.Author: Kezarkid
Reviews.Content: A very nice boutique hotel located in the Eixample district. Very good staff and hotel was very clean.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant location, lovely, relaxed, stylish hotel.”
Reviews.Author: mikeyc75
Reviews.Content: First time in Barcelona and this was a great spot for exploring all this wonderful city has to offer. Situated in a great shopping area and with the Diagonal Metro station just a very short walk away. We spent 5 night here and the staff were professional - a couple of staff members in particular were very friendly and welcoming and the hotel barman makes a fantastic dry martini! The rooms, although on the small side, were well proportioned and the bathroom was a good size with a great shower. We did have to ask a couple of times for the clock/alarm/ipod dock as there wasn't one in the room when we arrived (which is supposed to be standard in all rooms) but this was delivered by the second day. Overall the hotel contributed greatly to our stay and was an ideal base for discovering Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel BUT needs more cleaning”
Reviews.Author: jpmex
Reviews.Content: We loved the hotel. Its location, the rooms, the amenities. We stayed for 3 different occasions during the month. First we were upgraded to room 104 (Junior Suite) which was really nice and big. Then we were at room 604, perfect! small, but had a very nice terrace on the top floor, and finally we stayed at room 508 (AVOID THIS ONE), it is really nice, but seems the bathroom is enclosed and with no air vent, so there is mildew in all the shower area and the smell is terrible. We asked housekeeping the next day for a better cleaning but no change. Staff is very friendly BUT they are no locals, they seem to be from other countries, so they are not very familiar with the city, restaurants, nor services needed. In general I do recommend this this hotel but do not expect 5 stars.

Reviews.Title: “Good but could improve on cleanliness”
Reviews.Author: Serin
Reviews.Content: Perfect airconditioning system in the room, soft but comfortable beds, totally soundproof windows and walls, a large bathroom and plenty of storage space were the nice features of this hotel. I chose this hotel because I was fed up with the poor service and stained carpets and bed covers at the Casa Fuster. Murmuri also has stained carpets and bed covers, which I was not expecting for the price paid. The hotel could also consider providing free internet sometime in the 21st century. The restaurant Petit Comité a few metres from the hotel serves very good Catalan dishes.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: SASNY
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Murmuri for 5 nights based on reviews here at Tripadvisor. All in all, I recommend the hotel, with just a few reservations. We had a privilege room which was clean, comfortable and nicely decorated. The highlight was a large terrace that looked right out over Rambla Catalunya. Breakfast, included in our rate, was quite good, with a choice of fruits, yogurts breads, hams and cheeses, etc. One could order eggs as well. We liked the fact that the hotel is new and modern. It is also very well located-- only a 10 minute walk from the Rambla, but we were happy to be staying in a more upscale area, out of the noisy and touristy hub of activity. On the downside, the atmosphere in the hotel was very "hipster, trendy." Accordingly, while the staff looked the part, we found them not particularly warm or friendly, and they ran the gamut from fairly competent to totally inefficient. We had asked the desk to make reservations at the hotel restaurant (located only a few feet from the front desk), but when we arrived for our dinner they did not have our reservation. The staff at the restaurant and bar were almost laughably incompetent. Also, the hotel itself did not have much character-- it was pretty sterile in tone. Aside from the bar and restaurant, there were no common seating areas. For this reason, we were especially thankful to have our terrace. We tend to like the smaller boutique hotels because they have a more unique personality than chains, but we did not find this to be the case at the Murmuri. Despite these issues, we thought that the Murmuri was a nice hotel and a good value compared to other similar hotels, and thought the location was perfect. If we returned to Barcelona, we would definitely consider staying there again if the price/value ratio remains the same.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent combination of quality, location, and value”
Reviews.Author: davidxray122
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 days at Hotel Murmuri and were totally happy with the experience. The hotel has an excellent location, is very quiet - without the street noise common to Spain, the rooms were modern and clean, and the staff was helpful. The price was extremely reasonable for the quality of the hotel. Would highly recommend to someone looking for a high quality hotel at a reasonable price

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, beautifully designed, great location - will defenitely come back”
Reviews.Author: AbuBooboo
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located is excellent - not far from the Ramble, and inches from the Metro station. The hotel is beautifully designed and maintained, sophisticated and elegant. The staff are very helpful and forthcoming, and provide fast accurate service with a smile. The room is spotless clean, as well as the shower - both very spacious. I would (and already have) recommend this hotel to friends coming over to Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel with helpfull staff”
Reviews.Author: dd220786
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights in Murmuri in July 2009. We had a great time. The hotel is located near the main shopping street, La Pedrera (Gaudi) and at walking distance to the mayor sights and to the metro. It is a real design/boutique hotel. The rooms are well appointed with all the possible facilities (docking station Ipod....). and very clean.The staff are wonderfful, helpful and very friendly. It is a four hotel with a 5 star service. We would not hesitate to recommend this hotel and will definitely stay there again. Hope they can keep up this standard.

Reviews.Title: “Went Beyond Expectations - Five Star in My Book!!!”
Reviews.Author: JaniesWorld
Reviews.Content: We loved everything thing about this hotel. The rooms were sleek and comfortable. The pictures on the website were exactly the rooms you got. No deceptions here! The beds and pillows were comfortable, the bathrooms were big, plenty of counter space and great water pressure in the shower. Lots of room to move about. Very clean. The hotel was very quiet and in a very nice part of Barcelona. It was a quick walk to all the attractions and most of the action. The service was friendly and accommodating. The staff were wiling to help you and look things up for you on the computer and any problems were taken care of immediately. We arrived at 10am and our rooms were ready. We went to Venice for two days and they stored our lugguge. When we returned from our trip, after midnight, our luggage was already waiting for us in our room. I can't say enough about this hotel, we had an excellent stay.

Reviews.Title: “Style and substance - a beautiful hotel with fabulous service”
Reviews.Author: prbod
Reviews.Content: We have just had a lovely long weekend in Barcelona at this fabulous hotel. We booked a Premium Room, and at first were allocated a spacious room on the third floor. Although lovely, we had twin beds rather than a double, so asked to move. Without fuss, we were given a smaller room on the sixth floor, with the most wonderful terrace - very peaceful, beautiful furnishings, and thoroughly comfortable. Breakfast is languid and lavish - going on until 11, with a choice of delicious fresh fruit, cheeses and meats and the option of the lightest scrambled eggs and bacon, finished with rich, flavoursome coffee. The restaurant is quiet in the evening, but we ate outside at the terrace bar, and the food, though not cheap, is fresh, modern, clean Asian. Wine is good value. The staff are helpful, friendly, and bi-lingual, and happy to help with requests for recommendations. The location is fabulous, it is easy to walk around, or get the cheap, clean, and air conditioned tube to any of the multiple attractions. When you get too hot, you can go to their sister hotel, The Majestic, for a cool drink on their terrace and a dip in their pool. We loved, loved, loved this hotel and would definitely recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Boutique Hotel in a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: msbelgianian
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Hotel Murmuri for a week based on the suggestion of my client. At first glance, I wasn't sure I found the right place; there was a closed big black door obstructing the view of the lobby. Checking in, the staff was nice, almost too shockingly nice. The person directly helping me was new as the manager was "hovering" in a polite way. The thing that really gave me a strange feeling was when the staff escorted me to the room and showed me the amenities of the room (how the lights worked, wardrobe with safe, etc.) The hotel room itself was really nice. Warm inviting chocolate/beige textiles and modern bathroom fixtures. No issues with the size. Large enough for me and my husband (who stayed for half a week). On the top floor, there is a terrace for sun bathing and a table. My colleagues and I used the table to do some work. Hotel Murmuri has a sister hotel, about two blocks away, where you can use their amenities...fitness center, spa, pool and larger terrace with a good view of the city. We walked in without any questions and were able to use the lounge area near the terrace to work. The only downside is that I thought it was a tad expensive (but I haven't traveled to Barcelona for work before). For example, two drinks (cocktail and sangria) from the bar were approximately 22 Euros. The internet daily rate was 15 Euros. Overall, Hotel Murmuri was a comfortable place to stay for a week. Great access to public transportation, restaurants, shopping and Gaudi sites (e.g., Casa Milo, Casa Batllo). I'm not sure if I would stay here if I had to pay for it myself.

Reviews.Title: “I'll definitely be back”
Reviews.Author: Lleisiau
Reviews.Content: An excellent hotel . Lovely location at the top of Rambla De Catalunya, within easy reach of Diagonal Metro and walking distance of many sights .The rooms look exactly as the photos suggest . I booked a superior room ,through an agency and had an excellent deal for bed and a huge breakfast.Though around the corner is Mauri , a great , but not dirt cheap , cafe ! The room had the most comfortable hotel bed I have ever slept in and everything was beautifully clean ;sheets and towels changed daily .

Reviews.Title: “The best find!”
Reviews.Author: shermani
Reviews.Content: Hotel was excellent from the location to the amazing service we got. In addition, we had the best meal at the hotel restaurant for dinner.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotel”
Reviews.Author: sherwoodbaby
Reviews.Content: Had a wonderful trip to Barcelona and a lot was due to this lovely hotel. It had just opened when we went and we found it to be very comfortable and had all the amenities you could want! Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Underwhelming--High style, but poor service and small rooms”
Reviews.Author: Inveterateexplorer
Reviews.Content: Though it has a terrific location and occupies a pretty 1900 vintage building, the Murmuri is clearly a victim of its own success. Check-in in the small lobby took forever, and the scene at the front desk was a mad house. Upstairs, we found the rooms extremely small for the money and also very noisy--they definitely need to put breaks on room doors, which slam all through the night. Despite a DO NOT DISTURB sign on our door, two different chambermaids opened the door within a half hour, and breakfast was a dreary affair with little choice and mediocre quality. They're many better options in Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel - would highly recommend to anyone - and have done so already!!!'”
Reviews.Author: karrieParis
Reviews.Content: Very helpful, friendly staff who really aimed to please on all fronts - We stayed for 3 nights but had flights at odd times and they were so kind and adapted to our needs and requirements with a warm and helpful attitude. I would return with no hesitation and have already recommended to a number of my friends...

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location, would definitely go back!”
Reviews.Author: HappyFroggy
Reviews.Content: Really enjoyed staying at Hotel Murmuri. It's extremely well situated on Rambla de Catalunya, within walking distance of plenty of tapas bars/cafes/restaurants/tourist attractions (la Sagrada Familia is a 20-minute walk) and there's also a tube station just round the corner. Rambla de Catalunya is really pleasant as it has a pedestrian area in the middle where all the bars and restaurants have their terrace. The hotel bas (Bar Marfil) has a good atmosphere and lovely cocktails! The restaurant looked nice but we didn't end up eating there (too many tapas bars and local restaurants to choose from in the area). The hotel has no fitness center (really not a problem as far as I was concerned!!) but if you want you can use the facilities in the Majestic hotel just 5 minutes away. I'd booked a Superior room and was not disappointed. Quite often the photos that hotels put onto their website are not quite representarive of what you get but in the case of Hotel Murmuri I got exactly what the website showed: a bright, spacious and stylish room with plenty of gadgets (iPod docking station, ambiance lighting in room and bathroom, flat screen TV etc...). Bathroom facilities (and size) were excellent, and everything was very clean. As we were going for my boyfriend's birthday I'd ask them to get a bottle of Cava ready in the room. They rang me up the day before to confirm time of arrival and we found the Cava perfectly chilled when we got there. Front of House staff very helpful and polite. Breakfast buffet was also very good in my opinion with a decent selection of pastries, bread, cheese, cured meats, fruits, yogourts, omelettes etc... Shame that on day 2 the waitress in charge looked like she was having a bad day and was not exactly welcoming, but that really didn't stop us from enjoying ourselves!!! In summary, had a great stay and would definitely go back to Murmuri again. If you manage to book early enough you also get really good rates for a cit like Barcelona (the superior room with breakfast was 150 euros a night, well worth it!!!). Enjoy your stay in Barcelona, it's a FANTASTIC city!

Reviews.Title: “Day 1-4 of our Honeymoon In Europe”
Reviews.Author: garth1968
Reviews.Content: We arrived from Boston and found the hotel charming. this was the first stop of our 4 stop European honeymoon. We had booked through the hotel manager directly and all went very well considering the previous claims from someone else in the reviews. The hotel rooms we had booked, a privilege room, was big by european standards and had a private terrace/balcony with a partial view of Sagrada Familgia. Great for late night wine! Housekeeping was a bit unlike other hotels of this standard as we were told we could not get turn down service after 9pm on a Sunday night? Also, on another night we asked for the service and did not get it at all. The concierge serivice was so-so. At times excellent, but when we asked them for a local place to grab a slice of pizza, we ended up getting sent on a 2 mile search to a place that closed 25 minutes earlier. I believe if you are going to charge these prices, you should at least make sure you are sending clients to restaurants that are opened and close by! The Wifi was weak so we had to settle for an ethernet cable given to us by the hotel. Breakfast was so-so as well. Eggs/ meat was an extra charge and a toaster was not in sight? All in all, the hotel was in a great spot, is charming and has potential to be a dynamite place. It was also, very clean and the showers were great! With a few attention to details this could be a much better place to stay. Regardles, we enjoyed our stay very much and look forward to coming back. Make sure to go over the the Majestic Hotel ( their sister hotel) and to the top where there is a bar at night and an unbelievable view of the Passeig Gracia.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect small hotel and location for visit to Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: fpanda
Reviews.Content: Trendy design and decor, small hotel with wonderful restaurant and a Tapa's bar. Good breakfast buffet. Several blocks away is the sister hotel - the Majestic on Passeig Gracia which has roof top pool, bar and spa, and downstairs gym to which you have access. Murmuri is convenient to shopping on the Gracia...as well as close walks to the Pedrera and about 10 blocks to the Segrada Familia. Around the corner from the Murmuri is the Mauri, one of the best pastry shops in town. A signature dish in the bar at the hotel is the Baby back ribs in Chocolate sauce...not to be missed. The bar in the late afternoon was a gathering spot for locals. Our room came with a balcony.....perfect for a glass of wine and recap of the day. Staff very friendly and helpful. Avoid the old part of town on Las Ramblas....pickpockets abound!

Reviews.Title: “Livid”
Reviews.Author: newyorkold
Reviews.Content: Just one word, LIVID. We just arrived in Barcelona and were totally screwed in a bait and switch by hotel murmuri. Despite having made the reservation six months ago and having confirmed it last week, we arrived and were given a lame BS excuse that the computers had 'lost' our reservations (which is absurd and probably impossible). Instead of contacting us or rejecting our reconfirmation, we had to fly across an ocean to get screwed in person. Instead of a cute boutique hotel on a quieter street, we were given a really terrible, dirty room in a stuffy,charmles, Marriot-esque hotel affiliate with a view of pipes on the charmless, noisy Passeig de Gracia. The staff have done nothing to rectify the situation and have insultingly persisted in insisting that we're actually in a nicer hotel. I would not recommend this hotel under any circumstances. For your 'understated hipster hotel' experience, I would urge anyone to look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: naat61
Reviews.Content: i like to recommend this hotel because it's a beautiful place to stay... nice employees, great room with clean sheets and towels everyday, super restaurant and the breakfast was very good. the lounge is also very nice... so next time were off for Barcelona.... MURMURI is our place to stay!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent. Modern, Clean, and Very Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: mikeyp626
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I stayed at the Murmuri for 3 nights while we were in Barcelona. We were very impressed as it had a boutique feel but also had the comfort and luxury of a 4 star hotel. Just a little background on us for some more color. We like to travel and typically only stay at 4+ star hotels. Currently in this recession we are able to get great deals and Murmuri was no different. We live and work in NYC, so we enjoy the finer things and are willing to pay a little more to have them. OKAY, now for the review. First off, the place is small and has a boutique feel. The front desk/concierge was very helpful and friendly and allowed us to check into the hotel when we got in which was around noon. The room was good sized for two people and had all the amenities that we would expect from a 4 star hotel. The bed was clean and comfortable and the bathroom was well appointed and had a great shower (pressure/rain-like head). Also, one of the features I liked the best was the ambient lighting. You could choose from Ambient, Relax, Welcome, even TV mode. There must be something like 10-15 lights in the room that are programmed to dim and brighten with a touch of a button. It was a definitely a nice touch. I really enjoyed my stay and it was a nice change of pace from the cookie cutter 4 star hotels like the Marriott, Hyatt, Westin, etc. Don't get me wrong, I really do like the Westin, but it was a nice change of pace. Breakfast was included with the room and had everything you would want from a continental breakfast. Fresh fruit, croissants, fruit juices, cold cuts, cheese, small pastries, etc. Overall, I had a wonderful stay and would definitely stay at the Murmuri again if we ever went back to Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “nice, modern hotel”
Reviews.Author: anutaNY
Reviews.Content: The hotel was a nice, quiet hotel just a few blocks off most busy Barcelona streets. The rooms were clean and roomy, and while originally we were given two single beds by mistake, the next morning we were moved to a double room with minimal hustle. The rooms were very clean and modern but the light switches had only digital controls and were counter-intuitive. The complimentary breakfast was excellent. Although we did not eat at the restaurant, few drinks we had at the bar were great if pricey. There were few things that did not live up to our expectations. There was no free wifi, and the third party wifi service that was available was very expensive, around 8 euros for 45 minutes or 15 euros for inseparable 24 hours; on top of that it was painfully slow. It felt like nickel-and-diming considering the price of the room and the negligent cost for actually providing this service. Also during our stay the water system had to be repaired so we could not take showers or otherwise use the water for anything but flushing from 10a.m. to 5 p.m.; the next day there was also some scheduled power outage. While the hotel had no problem communicating with us via email over some billing issues, they did not bother to notify us about these scheduled repairs until our check-in, and did not offer any compensation for the inconvenience.

Reviews.Title: “We loved this little hotel!”
Reviews.Author: xntrc2b
Reviews.Content: The Murmuri has a wonderful location at the 'top' of the Placa de Catalunya. Its quiet, charming, and amidst great shops and bars/restaurants. The location is perfect for a short walk to the hop-on-hop-off bus, some of the greatest Gaudi sights, and a little longer walk to the hustle and bustle of the rest of Barcelona. The staff was more than friendly and went the extra mile towards being helpful. The breakfast included with the room rate was wonderful. The rooms are clean, modern without being cold, and very comfortable. We would absolutely stay in this hotel again without even researching other places to stay. The hotel is fairly new and there were new employees that were 'just catching on' but it was never a problem. Just make sure, when you ask for directions, you have the name of the street and which corner you turn on . . .

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, Great Location, Very Good Restaurant”
Reviews.Author: Mecnyc
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed three nights at the Murmuri. The room was small and clean. The shower had a faint odor of mildew--nothing serious. There was the smell of cigarette smoke in the hallway a few times, but not in the room, which was good. These are the only negatives--the rest was great--nice design of the hotel and rooms, elegant bathroom, cool lobby and elevator. Smoky bar, but the restaurant was isolated from this. We had a great breakfast there every day, and ate dinner there one night as well. For dinner, the menu is thai/continental fusion, which is probably not what people go to Spain to eat, but it was DELICIOUS. For 146 Euros, breakfast included, it was a superb value compared to other four star hotels we have stayed at. And the location couldn't be better--right by the subway and on the Rambla Catalunya. Staff friendly, helpful, and completely fluent in English.

Reviews.Title: “pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: christine2008
Reviews.Content: stayed here for 4 nights Thurs to Sun. Stayed in a privilege double/early booking offer. For this you pay up front for the room at a preferred rate and cannot cancel the booking. Included in this rate was breakfast. Firstly the hotel. small hotel in a nice part of town. Thursday night was very quiet but Friday and Saturday there was some screaming and shouting in the street, goodness knows how people cope with sleep in La Rambla, it must be a nightmare. Staff were pleasant and helpful. All bedrooms either look out onto placa de catalunya or a side street. We stayed in room 210 which looked out onto placa de catalunya and had a small balcony with 2 chairs. The room was on the smallish side but adequate, but this was perhaps due to the extremely comfortable HUGE (approx 7' wide) bed. There were two full length mirrors and you could choose from seductive lighting or full room lighting. There was a large flat screen TV with BBC and ITV channels and news channels. The bathroom was average size, lots of towels and the White Company products. There was a fairly powerful shower over the bath. Unfortunately the bath was a disaster. Being a shower perswon myself this is not usually a problem, but after hours of trumbling around Barcelona, a nice long soak was on the agenda. I sat in the nice deep bath lay back and nearly drowned. It was totally impossible to lay back in the bath without sliding under the water and drowning. The same happened when my husband tried the bath. I ended up laying on my stomach - I kid you not! The bar is very comfortable with seductive lighting and a nice atmosphere. There were people of all ages coming and going. Unfortunately the drinks were very expensive 11 euros for a coctail, 5.50 euros a glass of wine, 6.00 euros for a spirit plus 3 euros for a mixer. Perhaps not too bad when the exchange rate is better. After 2 nights dining in one average restaurant and one terrible restaurant, we decided to try the hotel restaurant which is thai/asian cuisine. The service was excellent, the portions very small, the food extremely tasty, and the price for 2 approx 100 euros (including a bottle of wine at 18 euros (the cheapest). This by comparison to other nearby restaurants was about average, many other restaurants were much much more. The breakfast was good - plenty of choice - cereal, fresh fruit, yoghurts, pastries, meats and cheese, toast and eggs of any type - scrambled, boiled, omlette, etc. but no other hot choices except bacon. This was included in my booking but i would not pay 20 euros for it. all in all we were very satisfied with the hotel, would recommend it and would go back if we could get a good deal.

Reviews.Title: “Would definitely return and recommend to family & friends”
Reviews.Author: StrumpetNottingham
Reviews.Content: We had a fantastic stay at Murmuri at the begining of April. We were lucky enough to be upgraded to a room with a private balcony but unfortunately the rain spoilt every chance we had of using it which was such a shame. The room was perfect and very clean & comfortable. The staff were always curteous and very helpful. We asked for advice on a few things, such as a good seafood restaurant in the area, and were never disappointed. We only had breakfast at Murmuri (which was delicious) and didn't end up using the restuarant but that was only because we wanted to explore. We did go to the bar a few times and enjoyed well made cocktails, which were very expensive by British standards, but then that was down to Barcelona itself and not the hotel. Overall we found Murmuri to be a very efficient, comfortable and chic hotel which we wouldn't hesitate to return to and recommend to any of our friend and family.

Reviews.Title: “Spectacular location, beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: ArthurLondon
Reviews.Content: Just spent 4 nights here with my family. Location is great. Its 10 minutes away from all the noise and action of the tourist areas. Located in the heart of the most upscale residential area with great shops and restaurants. Around the corner from famous gaudi apartment. Connecting rooms perfect for families. Its a style boutique hotel which unfortunately means service is a little off. Rooms are a little tight but well laid out. Small closets, nice bathrooms. Really good breakfast and active, smoky bar. AC is quiet and bed is very comfy. They don't keep a corkscrew or ice bucket in room. All around you can buy great cheap wine but hotel makes it hard to drink. Must wait for someone to bring up the one cork screw to use. Plus must bring up wine glasses and ice to chill. Only complaint. Concierges not as good as more full service hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant hotel”
Reviews.Author: jgodic
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent 3 nights here on vacation. Overall we were fairly pleased. It is a very attractive hotel, the decor is pleasant and understated. Some of the design aspects leaned towards annoying (light switches), but overall it worked. Our room was fairly small, but we were comfortable. It was spotlessly clean. The location is pretty good, far enough out of the fray to be relaxing but close enough to walk to most of the sights. Although the people at the front desk were very friendly, they gave us a poor recommendation for dinner our first night (Tragaluz, around the corner, avoid at all costs) and botched our dinner reservations another night. Breakfast was excellent. I'm not sure why wi-fi wasn't included, it was quite pricey, and the room rates aren't exactly cheap to begin with. If I were to visit Barcelona again, I would probably check out Casa Camper or another hotel. Murmuri was fine, but didn't blow me away.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent in every sense”
Reviews.Author: bee21
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at the Mur Muri this March. My partner surprised me with a trip away and we had a fantastic time. On arrival the staff were friendly and approachable. Nothing was too much trouble. The entrance is stunning and its individual style is classy and unique. Our room was spacious and stylish with an immaculate bathroom. Towels and bath robes were provided along with toiletries and a make up mirror. The terrace and our balcony were immaculately presented in fitting with the rest of the hotel. The breakfast in the hotel was fantastic. there was a wide spread offering almost anything you might fancy. Once again the staff provided an excellent service. My partner proposed to me during our stay and we have left having the most treasured memories with the hotel playing a massive part of our enjoyment. I would recommend this to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: madge21
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed at this hotel for seven nights in February. The MurMuri is a lovely hotel. I had requested an early check-in since I arrived in Barcelona after an overnight flight. My room was ready and waiting when I arrived at the hotel. The reception desk staff were outstanding - always friendly, pleasant, helpful. All questions were answered fully, and if the staff member wasn't sure about something, they would go online to look it up or check with another staff member. The room we were assigned was on the 6th floor (top floor) and had a terrace off of it. It was quite nice as was the bedroom. The room was not huge, but there was plenty of storage area for clothes and suitcases. The terrace had two chaise lounges on it and an umbrella table with chairs. There is also a larger terrace that is open to all guests on the rooftop. The bathroom was very large, modern, with a deep tub and shower and, a fully closing glass sliding door, something you don't often find in Europeon hotels. The room and bath were very clean and modern. Our room came with a continental breakfast which was about the same each morning. However, I never tired of it as it was quite good. It offered cereal, a choice of five or six pastries, sliced cheeses and meats, fruit juices, coffee and tea, and the very freshest and delicious fruit. The sliced fruit included kiwi, pineapple, watermelon, musk melon, oranges, grapefruit and whole strawberries. The fruit was top quality. I enjoyed the breakfast very much. There was an option for ordering off a small menu if you preferred a larger breakfast with eggs, etc.and I assume this was at extra cost. My daughter and I never felt the need to do so as the continental breakfast was so lovely. The continental breakfast was available from 7-11am so it gave us plenty of time to eat even when we slept in a little later. Because this is a smaller hotel, there is not a large lobby with sofas and chairs so it is not a lobby in which you gather there to meet, chat, or read. The reception area is somewhat long and narrow and there is only one sofa against a wall that was located right by the front door. It seemed to be a place to sit for only a short wait. The other thing I should mention is that there is a flat screen TV mounted on the wall in the bedroom, but I couldn't locate any English speaking stations on it. The hotel was very quiet and I did not hear much street noise. It is located in Eixample so it is a bit of a walk to Catalunya square, maybe fifteen minutes or so, depending on your pace. We thought the hotel was in a good location and we appreciated being in a quieter area, but within walking distance of much of what we wanted to see and do. There are many good places to eat in the area, and there is a Metro stop a short walk from the hotel. We have stayed at many hotels over the years in many areas of the world and this hotel was quite lovely. I will definitely stay there again when I return to Barcelona. I booked there because of reviews I read on Trip Advisor, and I am so glad I did. I think the hotel staff sets the tone for how you feel about a hotel, and this staff was surely outstanding in both making us feel welcome and always being helpful and pleasant. Diane

Reviews.Title: “Great choice!”
Reviews.Author: Philleas_Fogg_uette
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay at this hotel in late December. Our superior room was even better than we expected. The room size was fine, the bed was huge and very comfortable, linen great, towels and bathrobes all brand new and fluffy and the bathroom was very large with great pressure and rain-shower head. The air conditioning was very efficient and quiet and soundproofing was excellent. Quality bath products (white company) where a nice touch and we also liked the ambience lighting. Staff are very friendly and helpful and made great effort to recover our luggage which was lost by Alitalia. It was great having someone to make several phonecalls a day to the airport, instead of ruining our vacation by making these phonecalls ourselves and getting stressed and agitated all the time. That's the kind of service that makes a quality hotel like this worth every penny. Apart from that we thought that hotel's breakfast was great with eggs very well cooked to order and many other items of good quality. Plus we thought the location of the hotel was fantastic, and the area around it very upmarket and safe with lots of good restaurant options. We tried Botafumeiro on our last night (recommended by the concierge) and what a great choice it was! We would highly recommed this hotel and we will choose it for our next stay in Barcelona!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: lex2901
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Murmuri during New Year's week. Perfect, central location near the Passeig de Gracia. Great shopping area and Gaudi sites all nearby. There is an AMAZING tapas restaurant just a few blocks down - Cerveceria Catalan. We ended up eating there 3 days in a row it was so good. The hotel itself is small but stylish. We booked the basic room category but realized that it was too small. Extremely small. We asked to change rooms and were given another room, slightly bigger. Both rooms were nicely furnished and very modern. The bathroom features a rain shower and modern decor, as well. Very nice and comfortable stay. I would recommend to others.

Reviews.Title: “very nice”
Reviews.Author: jjpinney
Reviews.Content: Loved the hotel, we were upgraded on our 2nd night to a very nice room. The only negative is that it is a few blocks from Las Ramblas. Very quiet and nice.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Murmuri oozed class”
Reviews.Author: mickrick1
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Hotel Murmuri for 4 nights in early November and what can I say. When we arrived we were shown to our rooms by a smartly turned out and friendly receptionist. The room itself although compact was exactly what we wanted. The bed and furnishings were very impressive and the bathroom was full of mod cons. The shower had excellent pressure and there were more than ample towels. Toiletries were by Moulton Brown which was a nice addition. The location is just perfect - near enough to all the action but far enough away in the evening. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone and will definitely stay here again if I am back in Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “outstanding value”
Reviews.Author: barranqtraveler
Reviews.Content: This is a top bang for your buck. Great location, just half a block from fashionable passeig de gracia, where most of the luxury stores and hotels are. Standard rooms are a bit on the small size but otherwise great.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel in a very nice city”
Reviews.Author: ka2Europe
Reviews.Content: I liked the rooms and the location a lot. This is a very well kept hotel - not very cheap but the quality was very good. Everything was clean and nice, and i liked the details like Molton Brown toiletries etc. The decor of the room is teh standard Euro-almost-luxury stuff, nothing suprising, but nothing problematic. Apart from the staff at the bar being slightly slow (but this is Spain!), i have not encountered anything negative and would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Style , small rooms”
Reviews.Author: p_c37
Reviews.Content: Chose this hotel after seeing a review of it in a magazine , and certainly the location and decor can't be faulted . Modern , minimalistic style , simple and yet luxurious . Room was lovely , but small , though I suspect this is the case with many of the central hotels .Bathroom stylish , but shower not as powerful as you would expect from a recently refurbished hotel . That said , beautiful basin, Molton brown toiletries , lovely fluffy towelling robes and slippers , plenty of towels. nice flat screen tv in room etc . 2 minutes walk from the Diagonal metro station , and on a tree- lined street with plenty of outdoor cafes . Staff pleasant and helpful when asked , silent otherwise ! Had an excellent meal in the restaurant , a little pricey , but the service was perfect , and food good . Reasonable portions but not for those with a hearty appetite! Great location for a pleasant walk to all the central attractions , including La Rambla ( main street) . had a" Barcelona card "which covered all travel for the trip , including train from the airport to the city centre . Also gives small discounts on some attractions . definitely saves money if you are planning on covering a lot of ground , but probably not worth it for only a day . 3 day one definitely good value . Final note - BEWARE PICKPOCKETS ! My bag was stolen from by my feet in a restaurant , and the police station was full of people who had suffered the same fate . Obviously this is a problem in most cities , but it is certainly rife in Barcelona , and I have since spoken to countless other people who have had bags and wallets stolen there - it certainly seems to have a much higher level of pickpocketing/ mugging then any other City i have visited. Would definitely stay here again - but double check your room request - I requested a kingsize bed on booking several weeks in advance , but was still given twin beds , and was unable to switch as hotel fully booked .

Reviews.Title: “A reasonably priced boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: travelermiddleclass
Reviews.Content: Wonderful location, nice rooms, good value for the money. Wonderful location: in an upper class neighborhood, walking distance to Gaudi's buildings, Barri Gothic, and El Born. Near low key fine dining (read the nytimes.com travel article on creative plates at a good price), breakfast is easy -- go next door to Cafe Mauri (a Barcelona institution for locals) Nice rooms: brand new, real queen size beds (not the 2 beds pushed together you tend to find in Europe), nice furniture (not the cheap stuff that you find in the budget modern hotels). Only negative comments: The bathroom could have had better ventilation, a musty smell bothered my wife. The hotel is new and lacks the concierge team with connections to get you into places that are difficult to reserve.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Boutique hotel. Great location”
Reviews.Author: tomfrombkk
Reviews.Content: Came to Europe with my wife and spent 4 nights at the Murmuri. This is a fantastic hotel. Nice decor and great service which, for us leaving in Bangkok, means a lot. The quality of the fabrics, the sheets in the bed, the lighting with different ambiance, the overall atmosphere is relaxing and fresh. The service is also excellent from the reception to the maids, the bar and the restaurant. Everything was perfect. We were happy to hear that the famous thai chef Ian Kittichai took over the cuisine of the restaurant which is a subtile mix between mediterranean food and asian cuisine. You have to try it if you get a chance to have a table. We had great recommendation for dining out from the reception and located on Rambla de Catalunya, you have a lot to do around. Location is perfect, not right on the Barcelona buzz of the Ramblas but not far either (10 minutes walk). You do not want to stay there anyway. The location of the Murmuri is far more better, next to the prestigious and elegant Paseo de Gracia and next to some famous Gaudi houses. Our trip to Barcelona was great but our stay at the Murmuri made it fantastic. Stay there!!!

Reviews.Title: “5 STAR IN EVERY ASPECT”
Reviews.Author: Jx2000
Reviews.Content: Starting in April 2008 we booked 15 rooms at the Hotel Mur Muri in September for a 4 night stay for 30 people on an Incentive Trip. From the very first moment until check out I have not had one problem with the service provided by this hotel and in fact it leaves many of its competitors far behind: To summarise: The Hotel: The hotel is a newly opened boutique hotel that offers a real and viable alternative to any 5 Star Hotel in Barcelona and with its elegant styling and modern conveniences set out throughout it goes well beyond many expectations that you may have. The Staff: Impeccable is probably the easiest way to describe them, on hand 24/7 to ensure that your stay is what it is meant to be, perfection, front of house, bar and restaurant, cleaning staff and management were all great throughout the stay. The Service: We had 30 people all wanting different things from Barcelona during their stay and the service that the Hotel Mur Muri provided ensured that these expectations were delivered. The Restaurant: We had meals here on two of the nights and also breakfast every morning during the stay, excellent cuisine that is of the same standard of what has been set out above. The Bar: Class, World Class, brilliant service and great drinks. The Rooms: Designed with both flair and intelligence, simple touches such as the I-POD docking stations made for a great stay. On departing many of the Guests commented on wanting to bring the bed and pillows home with them as they were so comfortable. The Location: Ideal, close to everything but set in a calm street with little or no noise pollution I have organised many incentive trips for many people but the Hotel Mur Muri will set the standard for many years to come, brilliant service with the right attitude. Thanks to all the Staff at the Mur Muri, Edouard the General Manager and Raul the Group Sales Manager, you all should be very proud of what you have achieved. Recommendation: I recommend if you are in Barcelona that you don’t miss this Gem Alan Bateson

Reviews.Title: “Heavenly Murmuri”
Reviews.Author: BobfromNYC
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel in great location, in the Rambla de Catalonia. Easy walk to anywhere and a just a block from Gaudi Pedrera. We just spent 3 nights there and loved it. We had a very nice room with a little terrace. The staff was very friendly and professional. We had great restaurant suggestion from the concierge during our stay but also decided to try the asian restaurant that the hotel offers. It was fantastic. It is Thai/japanese with a spanish feeling. Interesting. Overall our experience at this hotel was great and recommend it to anyone.
